The sandoo was exceedingly greasy, though I liked the combination of cranberry, parsnip sage bread pudding, and mushroom seitan. I much preferred it to the monster burger. The bread was over-toasted and thus too hard. More disappointing, was how spicy the sauce was and how overcooked/overfried the patty was.I'd ordered donuts--cardamom and fig--from here in the past, but found the flavors underwhelming, despite the appealing names.

I was hanging out in the Chelsea area and heard this place makes some awesome donuts, so I had to pay a visit.Cinnamon Snail's donut selection was very diverse with unique flavors, but I restrained myself and ordered only two: Pumpkin Pie and the "Hulk Hogan".The Pumpkin Pie donut was yummy. Topped with a splendidly fresh pumpkin puree that was both thick and sweet (sweet from pumpkin and not from sugar) it really was the star of the donut. The donut dough itself was a nice balance between a cake and yeast donut; just enough density, but not too light as to fall flat from the puree placed on top.Onto the oddly named "Hulk Hogan" donut, whose display had a placard with the words "Fudgy Wudgy".This seemingly small looking donut was quite heavy in weight as it was a good 40%+ filled with an absolutely great tasting fudge (just look at my photo of the donut cut in half). Not to be overlooked was the nice crumbly chocolate topping which added a pleasant crunch. The donut itself was soft, fairly light, with a nice slightly honey-like flavor.Absolutely delicious, and I would buy this one again and again.Overall, I noticed the prices of the donuts to be up there (ranging from $2.25 for a non-filled donut to $3.50 for a filled one, like the "Hulk Hogan"), but each of the donuts I tried were of super high quality in flavor and appearance.Of note is that Cinnamon Snail has a food truck which frequents Red Bank NJ during the weekends, so Red Bank being closer to home, this revelation just made my day!

I used to say Vegan?? Eww.. But then I flipped when I had tofu cream cheese as well as vegan doughnuts in Brooklyn. I'm a friggin vegan!Well not so fast. I'm not rushing to No 7 sub and getting broccoli tacos. The "burger" they sell here is not something I'd order when Pat Lafrieda is a few steps away. However!I will make room for coffee and hemp doughnut. Are they hemp? Gluten free? All these labels. If you want to convert me, then don't tell me all the healthy science. Dough doesn't tell me whats behind the curtain, if I see a doughnut that looks appealing and no animals were harmed in the process then bully!I got my coffee (Outside of The Pennsy) and now I'm on a mission for a Vegan doughnut. I ordered a coconut-thai-basil doughnut. I grow basil in my backyard, I taste no thai and no basil. The doughnut had a nice coconut topping but the cake itself tasted a little stale.Best I ever had? Nah.. It was good but I'm not stomping my feet for The Cinnamon Snail doughnut.3 1/2 stars, I'll round up because they're saving the animals. Those tasty tasty animals..

THIS REVIEW IS FOR DESSERT ONLY!!!!This is going to be a short one because I only had dessert here but felt it was worth mentioning.While dinning at The Pennsy I passed by The Cinnamon Snail and did a double take. There was an entire counter full of yummy looking desserts and the sign read 100% vegan. I had to know what a vegan doughnut tasted like, so I got a chocolate glazed one and a peanut butter cheesecake brownie to-go. Devoured them both while on the LIRR. Holy crap they were delicious! I can't believe that they were vegan, they must be lying. Either way I was shocked. I'll definitely be back to pick up more next time I'm in Penn.Also one more thing I need to mention. I had noticed that on the counter there was a collection jar to donate to save cows and put them in a cow sanctuary. One by one each person donated. A dollar here five dollars there. I thought it was crazy considering that there are homeless people literally sitting right outside the door. Priorities?

This is for their food truck. Korean BBQ Seitan Sandwich...or the Thanksgiving platter sandwich. But the amicable guys in the truck recommended the Korean BBQ...plus that's what everyone was near ordering. Thaaaaat and half of the menu was sold out for a late weekend afternoon.It didn't disappoint. Spices on point, nice crisp tortilla shell with kale greens just massaged with oil and delicately cooked. Very well done. Ima want me some donuts next.

Omg! Why have I never been here before, I work right by this donut heaven! I had time to kill before I started work, so naturally I started looking for food to feed my boredom. This spot popped up on recommended nearby and the reviews seemed promising. This place is uhhh-mazing people. It is a must try if you're in the area, I believe. The donuts and assorted treats are all vegan and delicious. There are so many different flavors I have never heard of before. I walked up to a cute little shop with a gorgeous display of baked goods. The staff was friendly, quick and welcoming. This is located right next to Madison Square Garden on a nice little strip of unique shops. I will be back here very soon after I run off all these calories.

You'll know you're getting close when you see the mass of hungry looking protestors on break, past the bar area. you'll know you're close when you can make out the "meat is murder" and "vegan af" mottos emblazoned across their shirts. We went with the most aggressive name on the menu board because it sounded awesome. I liked it because it wasn't pretending to be near, but was still satisfying to eat, with the sort of cinnamony sweetness that was subtle enough to be enjoyable. The jalapeo mac and cheese on top made for a really weird mouthfeel and great taste. Too subtle on the bacon replacement, didn't really notice it, but it did no harm. The pretzel bun was tasty but dry. Vegan baked goods looked good so we grabbed the "chocolate peanut butter cookie doughnut" because those are the most beautiful words in the English language - dry and heavy but the ganache was good, wouldve liked less cake to the doughnut because it wasn't too dry with the center ganache on it.We grabbed a cider from the bar while we waited outside on a nice LDW Saturday. Lunch time wait in line for our food to be ready was like 10-15 minutes. Not so awful when you've got that beautiful view of no less than six hot dog stands on the newly blocked off 34 st.Great choice for pretty delicious fast vegan food if you've got extra time before your train.

Really liked the kimchi bbq seitan, it is very spicy but tasted so good. It is quite healthy too with lots of veggies, the wrap they had is good too, warm and a bit crispy.The have quite a selection of donut and dessert. I really liked the coconut basil donut, with all the sweet toasted coconut flakes on the outside, the basil taste is not too strong.Raspberry cheesecake donut is pretty good too, not too sweet and nice raspberry jam they have in the center.

Do not travel at a snails pace to get here and try this amazing food. Wow!! Amazing!! Everything delicious and if I could give them 6 stars I would, and I think they deserve bonus points for making reallyyyyy delicious food that is actually vegan.

I never thought I would crave vegan food, but I do when it's Cinnamon Snail. Ever since eating here, I have been craving the Thanksgiving Sandoo and Beast Mode burger.I am not a vegan, but I am fairly open to trying new things. With flavorful food like this, you don't miss the meat. Don't be fooled, it may be vegan, but this is not health food. I came with my son-in-law, who is a vegan, and he recommended the Beast Mode burger. It was delicious and humongous! The burger is spicy and smoky with vegan mac and cheese on top. It was really filling as well.For dessert, we all sampled some of the donuts. Our favorite was the lemon.I would definitely come back!

Amazing vegan donuts at a reasonable price. Each donut is priced differently, but each donut I got was $4 or under. I got 5 donuts: chocolate glazed, faux zebra, marble almond bacon, thai basil coconut, and something with lemon. The lemon one was definitely my favorite, which is a must try if you like that lemony taste. I wasn't a huge fan of the chocolate glazed and marble almond bacon. The chocolate glaze on the donut was crumbly and the almonds on the marble almond bacon bacon tasted burnt.The reason it didn't receive a 5 star for me is because 1) even though there was only one person behind me, I felt very rushed when I was ordering and 2) all the donuts were different sizes. In the glass display, the donuts were basically the same size, but when I opened my box, two of the donuts were literally the size of my fist. If you are vegan and enjoy trying vegan desserts/donuts, it is worth the trip.

Visited Sunday lunchtime, I ordered the Smoked sage seitan burger and my friend ordered a limited edition veggie burger who's name I can't recall.Burger was tasty and filling and again slightly messy to eat as a bit gloopy in texture.Ideally would like to give 2.5 stars but am going to give it three instead of two.I think had I not eaten at Red Bamboo where there burger was just as delicious and only slightly smaller yet half the price; then this burger would have got a definite three star rating.To spend almost $12 on a veggie burger in what is essentially a contemporary interpretation of a railway station dining area seemed overpriced. Especially adding the tax and tip. Water bottle $2.25 each.Service was perfunctory, the large African American lady accidentally stabbed me with her long finger nail and I then showed my friend the scratch when we sat down. Also she handed me the bottle, I asked for cups. A face was pulled as though it was such a hassle and she dragged her feet the 5 paces and brought back one cup, I then had to ask for another one even though I'd said cups not cup, once again the face and the slow pace. People have got trains to catch, perhaps her service style would better suit a slower environment where guests have more time.

Doughnuts are hit or miss... I've had amazing versions here or dried out strange ones. I can overlook that to support creative vegans!What really rocked my world is the Beastmode Burger. Huge burger full of interesting flavor combinations. Very heavy and substantial, I think I could get some meat eaters on board with this.Counter is adorable, plenty of seats. Bathroom upstairs. Fun place to grab a bite and get doughnuts to go!

Finally tried the thanksgiving Sandoo - incredible! Also shared the hazelnut brownie with my friend and it almost set us over the edge because it was so rich.The Pennsy has outdoor seating in the summer, so we took it out there and watched a jazz band that was playing. Nice.Edit 3/2017: smoked sage seitan burger was amazing. Smoked almond doughnut was dry but that's what I get for buying a doughnut at the end of the day. PB brownie was awesome.

I have been wanting to eat at The Cinnamon Snail for a long time, one of my dreams came true. I thought they were open for breakfast so I waited 10 minutes until the clock said 11 to go on in.They are known for their artisan and creative desserts. So right off the bat I order a glazed strawberry donut and the famous 'Cinnamon Snail'. The glazed strawberry donut was fluffy and big with not being too sweet(think Dunkin Donut but less sweeter). The 'Cinnamon Snail' was heavy on the cinnamon big thumb ups to that. Not a lot of frosting, but I really enjoyed it.Next, I order the miso teriyaki tofu burger with five spice Brussel sprouts, arugula and no wasabi mayo on a pretzel bun. Brussels sprouts are an interesting choice for a topping on a sandwich. I am inspired to stir fry those little tiny cabbages with some Chinese five spice seasoning. I liked it.A lot of seating with industrial furniture and small vases of flowers. Very clean and the people working there were super nice.

Fantastic food court food. Back in the early 90s I worked in the tower above and I just wish this food had been available then. Fresh, fast, and yummy. We had sandwiches and then a pastry. The donuts were so fantastic, that we went back and bought more to bring home. I have been rationing my bites so they last, as we don't live in NYC.

Fantastic!! All vegan! Got a donut and savory pastry!! Inside off the Pennsy. Prices are typical NYC prices. $9.50 for two pastry items!The location is cute and similar to a mall food court.Oh, they have the cleanest restrooms in manhattan!

My wife & I ate here on two separate occasions over the MLK weekend. I had the Gouchujang Burger and it was the best Vegan food I have ever had. My wife had the Lemongrass 5 Spice Seitan and really liked it.We went back another time to have chocolate donuts and the namesake Cinnamon Snail (which is out of this world). Do yourself a favor and stop in and eat this delicious food.

Very disappointed ( ordered Thanksgiving Sandoo and actually you can see what I've got on the picture... baguette was pretty fresh , but other ingredients were awful;( oily mess without any taste .But at least I liked donuts! They awesome! I had coconut and pistachio ones!

We ordered delivery from here on a cold Saturday morning. I'm usually a fan of vegan/vegetarian only restaurants because the food is typically very unique, and Cinnamon Snail did not disappoint! I ordered the thanksgiving sandwich and the beastmode burger; the burger was SO delicious with the perfectly cooked patty and mac n cheese bites in the burger! We also ordered two donuts, which were a bit expensive and not that extraordinary besides being speciality donuts and not too excessive sweet. The burger and sandwich were pretty huge, albeit slightly greasy, while the donuts were very small. Glad I tried this, although it may not have been the healthiest option, but prices for sandwiches are pretty reasonable.

The Cinnamon Snail in truck form has been on my vegan "To Do" list for quite awhile. Unfortunately I never got a chance to check it off before they hung up their...tires? Therefore, I can't speak on quality comparison between this location and the truck. With that said, I am definitely a fan of the Snail.Their donut specials and cinnamon snails are the perfect cure to any sweet tooth. My favorite meal to order is one of the sandwiches over greens and quinoa...perfect mix of healthy and delicious. It is a bit pricey, but the amount of food you get is big enough that you could share. I don't...but you could.I have even fed non-vegan friends The Beastmode Burger...and their carnivorous tongues liked it!Check it out if you haven't. The staff is very friendly and patient. Don't forget to ask about their specials.

I've been here several times and it is not the same as the truck was. I spent about $40 bucks and threw most of it away!! The beastmode burger is still good but the mac and cheese was disgusting! It was so mushy and had no flavor whatsoever!! The sauce on the baked ziti was delicious but was way overcooked!! The doughnuts were stale again and very disappointing. I want to love cinnamon snail and support a vegan business but you need to do better!! I can get a $12 vegan burger anywhere else including sides. Why should I spend so much when it is inedible??

I've been a fan of the snail since they were a food truck. They have a solid menu with some of the food truck staples - the Thanksgiving is always a great choice! I do miss the breakfast options. Their breakfast burrito was amazing.The sweets are also similar to the food truck. They had two snails (cinnamon and peanut butter chocolate) when I was there. Lots of cool donuts favors in cake or traditional.For my gluten free people, there aren't many options because most of the sandwiches are made with seitan. They do offer gluten free bread or quinoa and greens instead of the traditional buns at a cost. There are a few tofu/tempeh sandwiches. I like the spicy tofu.Pennsy, it's a pretty cool spot considering how annoying the Madison Garden area can be. There is plenty of seating but I recommend going with friend so they can hold a spot. There are lots of food options, so you can satisfy others food preferences, although I can't imagine someone not wanting the Cinnamon Snail. I think the highlight is the bar and music (sometimes there's a DJ).

I forgot that most of the people that rate on Yelp are mostly looking judging flavors. That said, this food is crap! I ordered the Korean Seitan Tortillas, and the plate is basically some seitan smothered in spicy (and salty) sauce to cover most likely it's bland flavor full of preservatives, jarred kimchi and some arugula to make it sounds healthier. All of this over a buttered up tortilla (which ended up being the most satisfying-non-msg bite) . Would never return here, yeah it's vegan but it's vegan crap. You don't eat vegan to get stuffed with highly processed food.AttThe Cinnamon Rabbit

If you think Vegan food is not tasty, then you should really try some from Cinnamon Snail. They have a permanent location at Pennsy, right by The Pennsylvania Station in Midtown. Ever since I had a taste of their sandwich and donuts (yes, vegan donuts!) from their food truck, I have been wanted to visit their Pennsy location.They have a few food vendors, kind of like an upscale version of food court, and they have more than enough seating on the floor to satisfy the foot traffic, especially if you count the outdoor seating.All the donuts lined up in the display window, a thing of beauty. They also change their specialty donuts everyday, so each you go there, you can try something new. Since we were there for lunch, and not just snacks, we also had to get some real food. They have really amazing sandwiches and the likes, with Asian influence, some spicy with real good kick. The Cinnamon Snail lived up to my expectation. Everything is super delicious, high quality, and they are vegan, so good for you! It could be a bit pricey, depends on what you get, but it is all so worth it! Read my full review of this restaurant and food on my food blog, foodlovergirl.

After seeing so many rave reviews, I was looking forward to trying this place! I am not a vegan or vegetarian but I am a yelper who is intrigued by trying new things. I got the Gouchujang Burger, intrigued by how that would even taste, and it was really full of flavor, even if I wasn't really sure what the flavors were. New and exciting! And very juicy and filling. I had to hold over the wrapper because juice was running out. It was really good and I'm glad it wasn't trying to taste like beef. If I want beef, I'll go get it. I wanted something different here.I also got the Hulk Hogan pastry. I'm hesitant to call it a donut because it had no hole. But it was chocolate covered with some chocolate filling. It's too bad vegans don't go for milk, because it would have been SO GOOD with a glass of milk. It was really rich and the chocolate on top was just getting all over my face and the napkin I was holding over. I don't see how anyone could have eaten this from a food truck.I went on Saturday and there was plenty of seating, but I imagine it's much busier on a weekday lunch. There are a few other businesses in the Pennsy, but this was the most popular when I went. I definitely enjoyed the food, but it is still a pretty expensive lunch comparatively for a casual lunch. And they don't have regular soda. I think if you aren't vegan, you'll find something new to try and enjoy, and there are a lot of options on the menu. I've had this place (well the food truck) bookmarked for a while now, and I can say it lived up to high expectations.

I have been vegan for almost a year, and have been following the Cinnamon Snail on Instagram. I decided to take my cousins who are vegetarian and nonvegan with me to try it out, and let me tell you, it was amazing!There was no line when I arrived, and we received our food in under five minutes. I first tried the beast mode burger which was smokey, spicey, and delicious! The pretzel bun was very tasty and the burger had a hint of coconut bacon! It was honestly amazing. It kept me full for a very long time, but the amazing thing about this burger (and most vegan burgers in general) is it wasn't heavy at all! Their food has many interesting components and layers, which I appreciated.The donuts were soooooo good. I never was a fan of donuts, even when I was non-vegan. However, these were amazing. My favorites were the lemon donut and the peanut butter chocolate cookie dough donut. They both had fillings in them and were incredible. The maple bacon one was kind of one note and simple, to be honest, but it was still tasty! Just not as interesting as the other ones. The brownie was quite sweet, but still good. My cousins and I were swept away! We finished all of our food, and are excited to go back again.

Oh Cinnamon Snail, I have drooled over you via Instagram for awhile now, since you were just a tiny food truck hopping all over the city. Finally, I got to sink my teeth into your insanely delicious, totally innovative, vegan comfort food in the new and uber hip, Pennsy market just outside of Penn Station. It was so absolutely worth the wait!! The only problems you will run into here are longer lines around lunch time, your donut of choice being sold out because it's so freaking delish, missing the chance to grab one because the chick in front of you bought them all or how to choose just one meal because they all sound and look incredible!Cinnamon Snail makes the kind of vegan pastries you can serve someone without telling them it's vegan and they will never question you. They're absolutely the right taste, look and consistency. Oh so good! So good! Better than some "normal" desserts I've had. And they're gorgeous! Check out Cinnamon Snail on Instagram for your daily dose of food porn. It's amazing what they do! So creative!The Hulk Hogan donut is what we split. Insane. Chocolate crunchy crumbles falling all over the place making you feel like a messy kid again digging into something you're not supposed to have. Oh, but wait, it's cruelty free, you're good.My meal? Go big or go home, right? The Beastmode Burger it was! I die!It's an ancho chili seitan burger grilled in maple boubon bbq sauce with jalapeno mac n cheese, arugula, smoked chili coconut bacon, and chipotle mayo on a grilled pretzel bun. Let me just say that one more time...jalapeo mac and cheese AND coconut bacon oh, AND bourbon BBQ sauce AND a pretzel bun! Say whaaaaat?! It was huge, bursting with all sorts of amazing flavors and textures. It was absolute perfection. Everything I love rolled into one outrageous, sinful sammy.I will be back. I will definitely be back. I will always come back. I'm headed back right now....here I come. That's it, I'm moving back to New York and camping out next to The Pennsy.

Ain't gotta be a savage to be a beast. Thank you cinnamon snail for finally giving me something worth posting to show people that vegans can indulge in delectable and monumental burgers like the beastmode burger deluxe. Not only did this burger look mouthwatering, it tasted just as good if not better. Believe it or not, the burger isn't even my favorite item on the menu. I would have to say what stole my heart...or rather my stomach...is their breakfast burrito. Yes that's right, this place has a breakfast burrito. And it is by far the BEST most delicious vegan breakfast burrito I have ever had in my entire life. So many appetizing flavors packed into one giant perfectly wrapped tortilla oh my gosh. I am literally salivating thinking about it. The only criticism I have with it is the kale. Word of advice...ask for the burrito without it. That kale was very unnecessary and took away from the oh so savory taste of the burrito. But either way...the rest of that burrito was just so good that I would still rate it the best vegan breakfast burrito ever. I also tried the hulk hogan chocolate donut. Man that one definitely did not disappoint either! I was completely shocked when I bit into the middle and a mountain of gooey, sweet dark chocolate started spilling out. It made that donut a million times better and convinced me and my boyfriend to immediately get up and order two more. Oh cinnamon snail....you will be the ecstatic death of me.

My friend and I was were browsing around in the city looking for good vegan food. We came across the Cinnamon Snail, read the reviews and decided to try it. I had a taste for some Italian and they had the baked ziti with seitan on menu, which was perfect. When I tell you that was the best baked ziti I've ever had! At the end, I had a sweet tooth. The Apple cinnamon donut was the perfect one. Neither one of us live in Manhattan, but we already can't wait to make it back to try more items on the menu.

This place is a vegetarian's dream. Usually when I think of vegetarian sandwich shops, they revolve around bland burgers and faux meat but The Cinnamon Snail was the exact opposite. I got both the Red Curry Grilled Tofu and Beastmode Burger which were both phenomenal. The Beastmode Burger was definitely one of the best burgers I have ever had. Beware that it is quite spicy, but as an avid mac and cheese lover, I think this is hands down the better of the two burgers I ate. The other burger I had was the Red Curry burger. This burger was flavorful but no where near the spice and combination of flavors as the Beastmode.In terms of ambiance, the Pennsy was probably a lot calmer at a lot of other times but I happened to go right before an event at MSG and found it hard to find a place to sit. Keep in mind that these burgers are definitely not tiny and can be quite messy so maybe coming here right before an event isn't the greatest idea, but regardless I enjoyed my burgers thoroughly. If you are not willing to get your hands a little dirty, coming here during an off time might be a better idea, but definitely worth a stop if you are in the area!

Amazing vegan burgers and sweets!! You cant go wrong with anything! just make sure to ask if its spicy (not always posted on description) and u may want to ask for the sauce on the side. Definitely don't leave without dessert!!

By far the best coffee shop in the area. ALT offers the best cold brew (with coffee ice cubes) and Americanos I've had. Their coffee leans towards the strong side but does not ever taste bitter. The baristas have found a way to brew coffee such that it does its job (wake you up) without leaving you with the usual aftertaste one gets from mediocre brews.The cozy patina may at first seem cramped or small, but how much better it is than a dozen desks full of people working or in meetings. The atmosphere you get at ALT is that people come here to relax, take a break from work, talk, and enjoy the city.Most customers do not stay so the three stools they have for sitting are surprisingly available if you do need somewhere to sit down for a bit.The current employees (Jake, Cooper, to name a few) are very good at remembering regulars and providing great conversation and good communication. And of course, they make awesome coffee.--Overall, ALT is an genuine coffee shop. It does not concern itself with being a coworking space that serves coffee or a faux-vintage caffeine dispenser. They just want to make good coffee.

I finally made it (accidentally as the MTA is messed up on weekends and I had missed my gym class) Every time I've tried to drop by, they've been closed due to limited hours.There's a bar seating for three if you want to sip on your espresso beverage but most people seem to grab and go.I ordered a flat white, not on the menu. Not what I expected but still tasted very good. I was actually asked if I liked it strong and how much foam which probably added to the enjoyment of my coffee.I also tried the almond croissant and it was really good. Definitely taste the almond without an insane amount of sugary cream of sorts.The barista (until I know a better name for the people making my coffee) is super friendly with all the customers. Definitely a plus.I love the chill feel of this place.

What a gem - so glad we found this place! My coffee was amazing and really smooth and perfectly textured milk. It is VERY hard to find a decent latte here in NYC - trust me. As an Australian tourist I can say we are very very picky with our coffee and only espresso style coffee is the standard - no drip coffee for us anymore.I really enjoyed the coffee and the pumpkin loaf ( which I love and we don't have in Australia - we don't do anything pumpkin sadly) the loaf tasted very fresh and tasty.The shop is so cute and although small feels open and light. The staff are amazing and very friendly - was a delight to meet someone who knew were in Oz we were from as his g/f is Ozzie too!!Definitely recommend coming here and supporting a great business with greater coffee.

Nothing could beat a small cup of latte on a lazy Saturday morning.Little taste is conveniently located in the middle of Chelsea, and has carried a handful of baked goods, including my favorite almond croissants. Cookies were also made hearty and carried an light yet attractive scent.Surprisingly, my latte had a subtle buttery flavor on top of its original creamy taste. Loved every single sip out of it.
Great little place to pick up a latte, expresso or specialty coffee. Delicious selection of baked goods.
A very little place. Interesting pastry selection. Good latte, but price is kinda high. There is no seating area, so I just made a quick visit.

I was psyched to find this cafe down the street from where we were staying. I had the latte.... and almost went back for another. Easy to miss this little cafe in the floral district. Not the cheapest, but was the best coffee I had all weekend. No seating, you get your drink to go!

Five starts to the barista and his piece of artwork Cappuccino.A Little Taste (ALT) is a gem, hiding itself in NYC's flower market on 28th street. Stopping by on a Saturday morning and all the three bar seats had been taken, I decided to wait. The barista checked in with me from time to time and told me I might have to wait for a while. I ordered a cappuccino and an almond croissant once I got the seat. The cappuccino is super fresh because the grinder was just got cleaned up by the barista while I was waiting. The almond croissant, from Colson Bakery in Park Slope, is not the best I ever had, but still good. By the time I finished everything and was about to pay, the barista just gave me an "everything is on me" smile.By the way, there is a show room behind ALT, which seems very interesting too. May worth a visit if you stop by on weekdays.
Had a great coffee there before an interview-hit the spot! Seating is limited but service great!
Awesome little coffee shop that I stumbled when walking through work in the flower district. Great coffee and great choice of pastries and great service.

My husband drug me here from the Waldorf, and all I could think during the trek through throngs if mid-town tourists to get to the 1 train was "I'm going to kill him, no coffee is worth this!"Well this coffee is worth it!! By far the best mocha I have ever had!! I plan tongue back again today for a second cup before they close!!
Cute tiny coffee place near FIT. Coffee is really good, pastries are decent, and service is quick, but there's not enough space inside to sit and linger. Good for take away quick breakfast.

This place is a gem! Sort of hidden but has great coffee and pastries for decent prices. The atmosphere is great and there is a showroom in the back, only problem is only about 3 seats inside so if busy (which it seems to be) then you have to take it on-the-go.

Popped in this morning because I ran out of joe at home. Ordered a large drip and a soy latte for my girlfriend. I usually stay away from soy lattes to avoid the blandness (one of my least favorite espresso drink iterations) but I tried a sip of hers and mmmmmaaaan, if you walk by and the super tall guy is working, get espresso. Dude knows how to EXTRACT. Killer milk froth, killer extraction, killer latte art. Their drip is also good, you can tell they put more attention to detail on the batch brew than the average cafe.

Cute little cafe hidden in the so called Flower Street. The place is tiny but tastefully decorated. Reminds me of a recent trip to Paris :) especially the baguette though I have not got a chance to try them. Soy latte is not bad. Will stop by next time I need a coffee break.

Cute little cafe with many handsome baristas but limited and average-tasting coffee and pastries. Plus, seating is also limited (meaning there are 2 tiny stools). Whoopie pies are okay and chocolate truffle cookie is more of a brownie. Flat white was pretty bitter.
I love this tiny and cozy coffee shop. It has its own personality. I had macchiato which was rich and dense. I would definitely come back again even just for a regular coffee.

This little shop is adorable and reminds Italy in many ways: coffee is superb and the interior design is warm and fancy. Sweets are excellent, I don't know where they get them from, but they picked the right guy! I had a kind of old-fashioned chocolate fudge and it was amazing.I have to give 3 stars instead of 4 since they served me espresso in plastic/paper cups instead of ceramic (it simply can't happen), plus it's not doable to have a chat inside - place is so small - , so it's not what I'm looking for when I get a coffee with a friend. I'm aware they can improve the first issue while there's not much they can do with the latter.

I have been in the city off and on this summer. My hotel is on the same street as ALT, and I would book a stay here just because of that. I LOVE this adorable little coffee shop with the friendliest staff and the most delicious coffee and sweets. Every day I get an iced latte, a perfectly ripe plum, and a raspberry donut. Divine.

Overall: best latte I had in NYC so far. I recently became a coffee drinker and I tried some places and they were too sweet for me. This cafe's latte was amazing!Things I liked other than the coffee:- Interior design: petite, rustic, and homey feelThings I thought were meh:- A line outside the store with a wait of about 5-6 min to order, which isn't bad when you have time and considering the coffee taste- Location where if only I'm around 28th St and want coffee I would go (so if you're mostly on 28th St, this aspect wouldn't be a meh for you)- Not a place to hang out. A place to order coffee (and see pillows in the back).- Service where you just order, give money, and get your drink

Literally the best iced coffee I've ever had. PLUS the ice cubes were made out of coffee.BUT it costs $5, whoa. That's basically the price of a latte anywhere else.I would go out of my way to come here for the iced coffee IF it was at a lower price point.

Truly authentic place with THE BEST coffee in NYC.I'm so lucky to work in the neighborhood. I have my daily ritual - to have a one cappuccino in A Little Taste. Yes, it is expensive BUT worth every cent. And to be honest, the cappuccino price in the area (Panera/ Pret/ Starbucks) is more or less the same - around $4. So if you are willing to pay $4/cup, please spend your money here, and get the most delicious cappuccino ever.On top of the coffee quality, you always get a friendly barista and a variety of healthy pastries. And also my favorite - small vases stuffed with the fresh flowers. Every week new color and style. For $10 each.
This is an adorable little place with one of the best cappuccinos I've ever tasted
5 stars for the coffee!Beautiful space, small with just enough countertop space to sip an espresso.

Yep much much needed in this neighborhood! This place is so charming Iam personally obsessed with the tiles and the rustic feel.And the barista who served me knew of one of my other hidden gem favorites - little Collins and was super nice to boot.And this place smells amazing - the coffee smell that all good places need to have.Equally important my iced americano was expertly made and the jazz in the background was super chill and soothing. Also this place has a/c but wins points in my book because they don't blast you out with it.There's pastries here but no lunch options but to me this seems trivial.

They lose a star for being too expensive and only having 3 bar stools. I am definitely spoiled and used to open spaces - welcome to New York! However, they only have THREE stools, in total. So keep it moving!My coffee was $3.50 and I also had a little snack, mini baguette for $8ish. It was tasty, but again, i am still hungry - welcome to New York!The coffee itself was delicious and pure, smooth. Fig and goat cheese mini baguette was tasty. The staff was super nice, charming, funny. I definitely enjoyed my brief time here! I will come again.
usually a line for coffee but it goes quicklydelicious coffee within the flower district
Great iced coffee and cute place. 4 stars though because I think paying $5 for an iced coffee is absurd and because of the price I will probably not come here often for iced coffee.
Cute little coffee shop. Great coffee and iced drinks. A little limited on the selection of pastries. Plan to grab and go as there is not much room inside (counter with three seats).
Coffee is great and authentic but the real stand outs are the cookies! I had a nut one and the salted chocolate one...They are moist and delicious!
Let me tell you something ! This Espresso is amazing ! Talk about putting a smile on your face. Fast accurate and pleasant staff will absolutely return !

A great little place! Their coffee is great, and their croissants/almond croissants/chocolate croissants are awesome - my French coworkers all affirmed that these are "real" croissants, as good as they are in France!

Sure, their coffee and baked goods are great. BUT, today I went in with my friend and I asked the three girls who were working there what one of their cookies were made of. One of the girls answered me, and because I thought it sounded great, I reacted with "oohs" and "ahh"s. But what do I see? These three girls exchanged sarcastic glances at each other and laughed at me! Kind of embarrassing me in front of my friend, who I was introducing to the shop!!I thought that was so rude. I hope this makes them know that although they may have delicious goods, customer service is KEY. I don't think I'll be returning, which is so unfortunate because I loved this place.
Cute little coffee spot with OK coffee and 10 gazillion dollar pillows and other stuff for sale in the back.

Latte was delicious, but the chocolate truffle cookie was out of this world. We had to go back before the trip home just for these cookies! The decor is adorable but the location is really random and there is maybe seating for 4 skinny models. Don't be fooled: the cafe is basically in the foyer of a decorating store, so you might see a table in the back. That's not part of the caf!!

This place is the best! Great coffee and such a friendly staff.Not much sitting space, but it's a perfect stop for a quick expresso, or a coffee to-go. There are a couple stools though if you can snag one!The regular coffee is great and not too expensive. Now that it's been warmer I've been getting the iced coffee (with coffee ice cubes!). The treats from Ovenly are delicious and you can not go wrong with any of them. Highly recommend this place, wish there were one on the UWS, because I would go every weekend!
Five stars for the peanut butter cookie, six stars for the coffee. More words to make this a review and fool the yelp bots.

The absolute best coffee I had ever had. Both the cappuccino and latte were outstanding. You can taste the espresso in the cappuccino. The foam is thick and creamy, even thoigh its almond milk! Im highly impressed. Though it takes a while to get your coffee its well worth the wait. And in the mean time their baked goods are also fabulous. The pistachio bread is moist and not too sweet, the ham and cheese croissant is like having a quiche loiraine in pastry form, so yummy. The currant scone is also super yummy!!!The place is tiny but the decor is really nice.
Some expensive lattes.... it was good but cant say its better that other places that are cheaper.

I am a fan. their drip coffee and lattes are great; mocha is sweet for my taste. Friendly staff. Cute space. Don't go here though if you're looking for a place to hang out. Good coffee, the you go in and out.

Popped in here today at the recommendation of the front desk at the Indigo across the street where I was staying. Really glad I did. Cute little coffee bar with friendly staff and very good coffee. I had a flat white and it really did have a buttery velvety texture to it. Would definitely come here all the time if I lived nearby.

Hands down best coffee I've had. The almond croissant hit the spot top. The whole place just has a vintage feel to it, love it.I wish this place was a bit closer to my job, id get breakfast everyday here. 5/5
Beautiful elegant interior, high quality espresso, friendly staff, and they sell Ovenly baked goods, which I love.
Omg, new favorite coffee shop around school!! Delicious regular black coffee and they have almond milk, I will become a regular and make sure to try every single cutsie pastries they have to offer!

The best coffee I've had in a long time. First of all when you order and iced beverage this place does it right, the ice cubes are frozen coffee so whatever you have isn't watered down. Why all coffee shops don't do this is beyond me. The service is fast and friendly, cute little Shop and the coffee is the best I've had so far. Wish it was in a better location, be ready to fight through a jungle of plans because it's like smack in the middle of all these wholesale flower shops.

I literally walked past here like 3 times when I was looking for it because it's so small but like the coffee is so amazing and the peanut butter cookies are lit. I'm definitely going to come back at some point since it's right around where I work.
One of the best espressos I've ever tried. Tiny hidden coffee gem. Food looks tiny as well:) i'd go for coffee only

Positively lovely latte. Delicious with perfect foam that I keep tasting with its abundant flavor. Wish there was more seating as this is the kind of coffee I want to linger over and appreciate... Alas, I'll get it to go and linger elsewhere. Pricey, but quality stuff.
Appropriately named, this spot boasts a pastry selection better than most.
I came here with high expectations based on the reviews. The pastries/muffins were good- about the same as anywhere else and the coffee was the same. It's an adorable little space.

I was so impressed that they got all five star reviews that I hv to try myself! It was absolutely great!! They use coffee ice cubes to make ice drinks. My ice latte has a strong nice smell and flavor of coffee that even I person like me who doesn't drink a lot if coffee likes it! Staff is so friendly and nice! You deserve 5-star!

I have a business nearby and love love coming here in the mornings or midway thru the day. Starbucks is right around the corner, but this is so cute and local and serves great coffees. One thing I've taken to are their soy lattes...Starbucks puts sooo much sugar in theirs and A Little Taste does it just right! Only wish they had a lil more seating so I could chill longer :)
great latte and pastry/cookies. too tiny for words though. not a good winter choice if you want to sit and have hot coffee.and perhaps a bit too hipster.

the decor is charming, and the guys behind the counter friendly; but i should've known when i ignored my own warning to walk away when nothing is marked with prices that our small treats of an almond croissant and a quiche would be about $5 each. don't get me wrong, our afternoon snack was just what we were craving, but my almond croissant didn't taste much different from the ones from pret a manger. i get it, the baked goods are brought in from partner suppliers so of course there is going to be a mark up. in any case, the next time i'm in the area, i would stop by for just coffee.

How people go to Starbucks a half a block away is beyond me. This is the BEST coffee place in NYC. I accidentally stumbled upon it, because it's sort of hidden if you don't know about it. All I can say is visit this place if you want THE BEST.

My fav stop by coffee spot in Chelsea. There's a showroom inside. The vintage style interior is a plus. I wish there could be more space to sit or to stay for a period of time, as it is soooo beautiful.

The pastries were exceptional. They tasted very fresh and light, similar to bakeries in the Olde World. The ambience was calming and sophisticated. The sewing area in the back was quirky, but I did not understand what its purpose was. The lack of seating was slightly annoying since there were not parks nearby to each and drink out purchases at. The coffee was very rob and delicious, though, and the prices were very affordable, also.

The caf is super cute. It's really small, not having much seats at all (one small wall table and a few seats) but nonetheless, it was a nice atmosphere. The workers were super nice and courteous. The beverages were amazing. The ice coffee had iced cubed made from coffee to keep t from getting watered down, and it was a perfect mix of sweet and bitterness. It didn't leave the feeling of coffee breath. The hot chocolate had a lot of cream in it, but it wasn't super sweet. It was at a perfect temperature to drink, not burning hot or too cold. The chocolate croissant was really good, having bits of chocolate in it that wasn't too sweet and the croissant itself was nice and fluffy, not overly buttery either. Overall super pleased and the price was totally worth it, as it wasn't much more expensive than a nearby Starbucks and the quality was much better.

Coffee=5 Service=5 Decor=5Great little hidden gem in a busy commercial area. Excellent Cappuccinos very smooth... And yes I may be a sucker for the artwork in the froth but it's also an indicator of attention to detail. Once you've had a Cappuccino like this it gives you a greater appreciation and point of reference when compared to the mass-produced, production line, factory - coffee places. French press nicely done. The staff is very friendly and even if you've only been there your second time they make you feel as if you're a long time regular. They make it a point to remember you and your drink preference. Although seating is limited, the rustic decor is inviting and well done. The only thing that could make the coffee better would be an organic option.

Great little spot to get real coffee, espresso, lattes... The deserts are great and very sinful. Salted peanut butter cookie, and Latte was my last. The cookie is soft and wonderful. Prepare to devour more than one.Great decor wished for more seating. Hope this place last long since it's hidden and you might miss it.

This is definitely my favorite bagel place in NYC. To my surprise, when I came home with some bagels, Raymond declared that it was also his favorite and tried to take credit for introducing me to it. :p I don't come here often because I've never lived anywhere close to here, but if I have time, I would go out of my way to come here.My latest trip was for deconstructed bagels; I had guests visiting, and I wanted to make them bagels in the early morning the next day. I bought 1/4 lb sliced smoked salmon, 1/4 lb jalapeno asiago cream cheese and 4 everything bagels for $32. I added 1/2 avocado at home to each bagel, which made this a total of 8 breakfast meals (aka $4 per person). Of course, they're way more generous with the cream cheese and salmon in store if you order bagels there, so I think they're very worth it. The cream cheese variety is just absolutely unbeatable; the jalapeno asiago and bacon scallion are my two favorites; they're so good that you can definitely just enjoy the bagels with only cream cheese. The flavors are rich and complex and totally addictive. You won't regret it :)

The lines go out the door at this place. New Yorkers take their bagels seriously. I've gotten their rice pudding a few times and it was amazing. I've also gotten a bagel which was pretty good but can't remember what it was. I need to go back and try something else.If you are interested, they also carry rainbow bagels.

***Updated Review***I have updated my review from 1 to 3 stars. I will have to compliment Brooklyn Bagel's management in replying to my complaint and trying to make things right. After contacting management, I would give this place another shot. It was communicated to me that their were 2 new employees at the location at the time so that might have been the reason there was such a lackluster customer experience.***Original Review***Absolutely horrible experience here. Food is nothing special but customer service is absolutely abysmal. Ordered 4 items. Nothing special, no substitutions. Waited over 15 minutes to get my food while people behind me received their order. The people at the registers were completely unsympathetic to my situation. I asked to see a manager and was brushed off. I went all the way across town to come to this place and I will never be coming back. I will post this review to all the websites I can to try and steer as many people away from this place as possible. Completely dissatisfied.

I adored my onion bagel with scallion cream cheese. The bagel was perfect: lightly toasted, flavorful, chewy, and huge. The cream cheese was creamy and there was plenty of it. I took a bite of my boyfriend's breakfast sandwich, which was also great -- egg was cooked perfectly, and his garlic bagel was addicting.The price is a little high, but in-line with what I've come to expect from New York City. And it's totally worth it.The place obviously gets quite crowded, with a line out the door. I would advise doing your best to know what you want before reaching the counter. The staff is mostly nice enough but not very patient if you stumble through your order. They are great at remembering your order, though! I rattled off a somewhat complex order and the guy memorized it perfectly and my food was entirely correct.

The line was nearly to the door with an approximate 15 minute wait which was expected for a mid Saturday morning.We got an everything bagel with garlic and herb cheese. There was a bit too much garlic unless you like a bite every bite. I will say, I would go again but this time try another cream cheese flavor since there was a multitude of other interesting flavors to try.I did snag a photo of what appeared to be chicken directly below the cream cheese that I don't know how to describe except for not something I want to eat.Would go back just that weird chicken business is the reason for the lower rating.
Easy, good, fast, fun, fair...This is the typical dinner where you get what you pay for...Good food, great bagels, lots of cream cheeses to choose from and not that great coffee

I absolutely love this place! This is our go-to spot at work when it comes to catering breakfast. Brooklyn bagels never disappoints. Their bagels are always fresh, hot, yummy and with all the different and delicious cream cheese, the options are endless.My go to bagel is the egg bagel. Super soft and fresh. Delicious with some freshly made veggie cream cheese! Always in bliss when I chow down on this bagel.Very fast delivery and very amazing and friendly service.

BEST BAGEL IN NEW YORK PERIOD. NO CONTEST.If you are looking for a proper New York bagel, this is your place. The bagel is the perfect amount of fluff, chewiness, and crunch.Get the whole wheat everything. They have a huge selection on cream cheeses - my favorites is the low fat dill / cucumber. Although they stuff the bagel with loss of cream cheese, the many low fat choices make me feel a bit better.Careful though, like all bagel places, it gets pricey the more proteins that you add onto it!

So many choices for cream cheese.My wife got the loxs and bagel sandwich was amazing, I got the the eggs and bacon breakfast sandwich on an everything bagel. It all tasted amazing. I would go there again next time I'm In the area

YUM NY Bagels are just the best!!! soo many choices for cream cheese and bagels it is a little overwhelming! but very quick line to go and grab a bagel. a little pricey for a bagel (compared to like.. dunkin donuts) but they are delicious. i want to come back and try different bagel and cream cheese flavors!

The bagels here are pretty good, but also very pricey. They have a huge selection of bagels and spreads, which makes for endless combinations. It was pretty crowded when I popped in around 9:00 a.m., but the line moved fairly quickly. They have a small seating area with tables, and I was able to snag a seat for one.I ordered a poppy seed bagel with scallion schmear and lox, which was $13. I definitely was not expecting it to be that expensive, but portion size was huge, so that made up for some of the high price.While the bagel was tasty, it definitely wasn't the best bagel I've had. You'd likely be able to find better, cheaper bagels elsewhere, but this place is still a solid bet and worth checking out.

Darn good bagels. I would know because I bought 28 of them, and lugged all 28 of them across Chelsea on foot in order to get them on my bus back to Boston. I sacrificed precious leg room for the two giant brown bags (and I mean giant. These bagels are huge), and don't regret a second of it. Every drop of sweat and every ache in my back was worth it because my freezer is now stocked full of these delicious rings of dough.Next time, I'm coming for you smears. And I can't wait.

Sunday morning shit show but bagels are insane. I tried to subvert the line by using the app but didn't realize it would have been a lot smarter to wait in line. Estimated App fulfillment was an hour. The manager helped me out so I didn't miss my train. Excellent staff and quality is obvious if you look at the line. Waiting wasn't fun but not their fault - wish the app warned me before placing order as to how long it would be. All good.

Yep, five stars. As bagel shops go, this is as good as it gets. In just over a week, I tried the same bagel (toasted everything with cream cheese and tomato) at five different places and decided that this place had the best.Once the decision was made about the best place (I was on a mission to eat a bagel for breakfast every day while I was back in town) I got adventurous with my bagel order. I tried their pickle cream cheese (not bad), their low fat cream cheese, and...their pumpernickel everything bagel is awesome!The bagels are made right there, the place is clean, the choices are many, the line moves quickly, my orders always came out correctly, and the cashiers were pleasant. What more can you ask for? Well, perhaps good coffee. To be fair, I didn't try their coffee because the walk to get the bagel was fairly long and I passed several Starbucks along the way. By the time I got my bagel, the sugar in my coffee was dissolved and it had cooled off enough to drink. Morning perfection.

This place has some awesome bagels. It is mine and my bf's favorite bagels in NY. Living in SF, good bagels are extremely hard to come by. It's kind of like pizza. Pizza in NY tastes way better than pizza made elsewhere in the US.Le bf and I always pick up bagels the day that we leave NY to fly back to SF. Knowing that lines could get a bit long, I ordered ahead via their online ordering option. I ordered a total of 1.5 dozen bagels (and they were quite hefty). They were also kind enough to slice all of my bagels, when I asked. When I got there on a Saturday morning around 8:30, there was no line and my online order was ready to pick up.You know a bagel is good when you can eat it 1-2 days later and it doesn't need to be toasted. I just make sure to put my bagels in a ziplock bag as soon as I purchase them, and then stick them in the freezer if I know I won't be eating them after 3 days of purchasing them.Le bf and I haven't found better bagels in NYC. We only come here for the bagels and haven't tried the other menu items.Tip: You can skip the lines if you ordered ahead online. You can just go to the cash register, say your name, and be on your way.
One of the better bagels in NYC with a variety of selection and you won't break your buck.They also have a variety of cream cheeses.The morning can get busy here but worth trying if in the area.

Came to new york for a week and staying in Chelsea. Had bagels here almost every day. Delicious and they have so many options for spreads! I'd recommend getting the mini bagel (which is a normal sized bagel) with the scallion lox spread

4.5 stars. It was bagel, lox, and cream cheese time! I got a whole wheat everything bagel which was great- i'm a big garlic fan so I loved the garlic topping. It was fairly soft/ fluffy as well. Scallion cream cheese also very good. Lox was also good though i think the Russ and Daughters salmon was slightly better.The bagel was huge and they were very generous with the cream cheese so it was a solid meal. Overall I preferred this to the Russ and Daughters bagel sandwich I had though I did get slightly different ingredients. Also a better value due to the heavier portion.

Love the pumpernickel everything bagel! So good. Had it with the standard Nova Scotia salmon and cream cheese. It was as enjoyable as bagels get for lack of better terms haha. They definitely put a more than adequate amount of lox in the bagel which is a major plus since lox in any bagel leads it to be over $10. If you're big on cream cheese, there is a plethora of options here. Enjoy!

I regret ordering a bagel without cream cheese because they have an awesome selection. The sesame bagel is okay but I thought the highlight was their amazing coffee! I'm no coffee drinker but after an overnight flight with no sleep I needed caffeine. I got their hazelnut slow drip and it tasted great, very smooth and fantastic nutty flavor.

I think this may be one of the best bagels I've had in memory. Service was quick, not super friendly, but they were busy even at 10:30am. I ordered a toasted mini whole wheat everything bagel with low fat cream cheese and it came out to be almost $5. So much cream cheese, though, that I scraped a lot of it off. But the bagel was so good! It was perfectly toasted and chewy without being overly chewy. I ate half of it and then the other half a couple of hours later and it was still the perfect texture. None of that soggy softness that bagels can end up like sometime. A little expensive, but I thoroughly enjoyed it.

Outstanding. We decided to grab a couple of bagels to eat on our trip back to LaGuardia..that being said, I'm perfectly aware that the quality of said bagels would've been even better had we ordered them fresh, first thing in the morning. The bagels were a little chewy by the time we made it to our final destination and were able to sit down and enjoy them. However, the service was extremely quick and the variety of breads and spreads was impressive. I ordered a pumpernickel bagel with smoked salmon "lox" spread--divine. That's probably my favorite bagel/spread combination and I was not disappointed. They don't skimp on the spread; by the time I finished by bagel I think I'd likely consumed about half a tub of cream cheese. There's nothing like a decent NY bagel and this place is tops.

This place should be called Brooklyn Bagel & Cream Cheese!The cream cheeses are really the star of the show! There are crazy combinations like honey bacon sriracha to good old blueberry. You have so many options to pick your bagel concoction, starting from the bagel bread itself to add-ons from smoked salmon to egg or cheese. New Yorkers really love their bagels.Once you find this place, the long line out the door gives it away. We didn't have to wait too long outdoors, but stood in line for a solid 20+ minutes on a Saturday morning. Not bad! The menu is quite confusing like where you should order and what exactly is on the menu...and for Californians, we were overflowed with choices. We were urged to pick fast, so I went with the multigrain bagel with the lox cream cheese (bits of smoked salmon), add smoked salmon and swiss cheese. They grilled my bagel, but I wish it could have spent more time in the oven because the cheese didn't ooze through. The cream cheese was just DE. CA. DENT! They really aren't cheap with the spread, and for me it was way too much cream cheese. Delicious, but in moderation folks!I also got a banana, and the whole breakfast lasted me until lunch because I had to save the other half of my bagel for later in the day. I saw that some other people got a rainbow bagel (whoa) and others ordered crazy cream cheeses with a coffee to go. Service is fast and in a rush, so have your order ready by the time you get to the front. A smart tactic is having one person stand in the battlefield AKA seating area to grab a seat/table when an opening comes through while the other one orders. We were lucky to snag a larger table for the four of us.There is free wifi, but I didn't get the chance to ask by the time I got to the cashier. Restrooms are also a-plenty, and the spot is warm and comfortable for families to enjoy their brekkies, or mad dashers to take stuff to go.

Coconut bagels with strawberry cream cheese? Even my finicky father smiled when he ate that combo. This wonderful shop has delectable, ridiculously fresh bagels in so many varieties. Even better, though, are there cream cheese concoctions, that will leave you in silent awe.Lines are always long but the upside is you can always have a chat with the person in front of you. According to the cop yesterday, who was buying bacon scallion cream cheese, his favorite, Dunkin Donuts is no longer the go-to-spot among sophisticated cops. `"When in `Chelsea....."

Endless possibilities of cream cheese spread for whatever your heart desires.It was a cold and early Sunday morning as we began our trek to Brooklyn Bagel & Coffee Company. There was maybe only about four other people in line so we didn't need to wait long to order nor for our food.My sausage, egg, and cheese on whole wheat bagel wasn't as stuffed or cheap as the previous bagel I had a few days prior but it was still yummy and filling for my stomach. Eat it while its nicely warm and toasted.

I happened to be in the area for work - and after crazy hours the previous day, I had an equally crazy craving for a bagel bright and early. I scanned Yelp for nearby gems, and decided on Brooklyn Bagel & Coffee Company.So. Many. Cream. Cheese. Options. Fortunately there were a few people in line so I was able to scan the case of goodies. I also kept an ear on how folks ordered in case there was a secret "Yo, I'm local" code."Ohooooo, everything bagel with honey bacon sriracha - the breakfast of CHAMPIONS!" Thundered the manager as I walked up to pay for my purchase. Quick greeting and payment, and I turned to leave - and almost dropped the bag. That bagel was heavy.Just in case:Me: "Wait - this is my order, yea?" *peeks in bag*Mgr: "Yea, that's you hun!"So much for trying to blend in. :PTaste, texture, bagel to cream cheese ratio ... delightful. However, it was an entity of cream cheese and carbs so massive it had its own gravity (it attracted several coworkers within a 25 ft radius) - there's no possible way I could eat the whole thing ...It took the entire morning, but I ate it all. *shame*I'll definitely pick up a tub of cream cheese to go next time, and will try to not eat the whole tub on the Acela home!

Came here on a freezing Saturday at 945am and the line was almost at the door! Thankfully, the line moved very quickly. The staff were incredibly efficient with taking orders, preparing the food, and working the register.While we lined up I scoped out their spread flavors and they have a huge selection and some really interesting ones! Some examples are honey bacon siracha and cannoli.I got the classic toasted everything bagel with scallion cream cheese and fresh lox. My husband got the Hungry Man (eggs, sausage, cheese, hashbrown, and bacon all in a wrap). The total came to $21.We absolutely loved it!! The bagel was on point. Ate half, then saved the other half for later. It was pretty expensive (it always is with fresh lox) but totally worth it.

Busy busy busy......Is is always this packed or was it because it was the week after Christmas. I'm inclined to believe it is always packed.This was my first intro to a New York bagel and I wasn't disappointed. Ten minutes in line and another ten waiting for my order, it was very worth it. You also need the wait time for a table to open if you are staying. So many delicious choices of bagels and even more in interesting combinations of smear. I went simple- whole wheat bagel with its fluffy yet dense interior and chewy outside, slathered in a fresh fig cream cheese. Perfection to start my first day in the city with.Yes, I'll need to return again.
Legit bagels. Flavorful, chewy. Buy 'em by the dozen. I like them better than Ess-a-Bagel. And they make a unique pumpernickel everything bagel. Yum.

I was walking in Chelsea and wanted to have quick breakfast. I browsed on Yelp and this place came up. It was walking distance where I was, so I decided to come here.I arrived here around 8am, and the place wasn't packed yet. No line to order. Yay! There are so many cream cheeses and bagels to choose from.I ordered bacon scallion cream cheese on everything bagel which seemed to be a popular choice. They asked me if I wanted it to be toasted, and I said yes.I waited a few minutes for my food to be ready. They called my order, so I paid and sat down.I opened the bag and was surprised how big and heavy was.I had a bite. Tasted like a burnt bread. I had another bite. The same. They toasted my bagel too long.I'm honestly disappointed in my food. I may have got a wrong item, but it wasn't certainly good or impressive.The staff and the service were okay. It wasn't busy, but the staff wasn't very nice or friendly.I won't come back here.

Past by this place several times and the line was out the door. Finally came early, because really wanted a bagel and my go to place was closed.I had a plain bagel with cream cheese. Price wise they are similar to other places in the city.As far as taste goes, this is where it gets interesting. Several people in front of me were asking to have their bagels toasted. I like mine fresh, so passed on the toasting.The taste of the bagel was above average, but the texture was very tough. All I can say is, eating this bagel, you will give your jaw a serious workout.Overall this place is a solid 3, for me there are other places in NY which I think serve better bagels. I would come back if in the area and no line. Not worth it if you have to wait online.

The best lox bagel I've ever had. The line was long but worth the wait. The fresh squeezed orange juice was delicious and refreshing. My husband had the everything bagel with pimento cream cheese. We will definitely be back!

Super fresh tasty bagels, and the spreads are terrific as well. We got a bunch of different kinds of bagels and spreads for a group of 5. We all ate in silence enjoying these bad boys. We also had one person who ordered the smoked salmon sandwich with capers who said it was super fresh and tasty.They serve great coffee here as well, as well as some other baked goodies. Great place for an NYC breakfast if you've around there, or if you are just passing through penn station.

I came here looking for the rainbow bagel, because I couldn't make it to the other location. I figured this was the next best thing. It's kinda like subway, where you tell the person what bagel you want, what you want in the bagel, toasted or not and then pay at the end of the register. They had a tye dye bagel rather than a rainbow bagel. It was an average bagel but the creme cheese is what got me. It's absolutely delicious. It was creamy and fluffy. I'm almost okay with spending $5 on a bagel because the creme cheese was that good

Awesome bagels here and they are huge! They have many flavors including whole wheat which is my favorite. They also have 4 varieties of tofu cream cheese :D The whole wheat bagel + generous amount of cream cheese kept me very satisfied for a while.They also have almond/soy milk for coffee which is rare in a bagel store I've realized. Thank you! I was able to enjoy my bagel with coffee finally.The store has a decent amount of seating compared to other bagel stores I've been to. It was busy even in the afternoon. Very popular spot!Would definitely return for a solid bagel treat.

Oh yum. I haven't been to NYC in quite some time, so when I returned, I knew I needed a bagel at least once. On my last morning, I was on a quest and my friend suggested this place.Ambiance: Super casual. Equal number of regulars and tourists alike while I was there. Some people ate in, some took theirs to go.Food: My friend recommended a mini everything bagel with scallion cream cheese and fresh lox. I did as told and did not regret a thing. Their mini bagels are great because they are the perfect size and I was able to finish mine. It provided a solid base to my day before I would have to make my way to the airport later that day. I normally don't even like everything bagels, but I loved this.Price: A bit pricer than I would have expected for a bagel, but I did put lox on it, so I guess there's that... I think it ended up being close to $13?Would I return? Yes! It was THAT good. Oh yeah, they also have those rainbow bagels you see on Instagram. That was one of the other reasons I went here originally, but when it came down to it, I just wanted the classic.

Here in NY for a few days with my kids, I accidentally stumbled upon this place while we were looking for breakfast. What a find! I don't think I've ever had a legit NYC bagel before, but I think I've had some decent non NYC ones-but I can definitely say this was the best bagel I have ever had! Possibly spoiled all others for me!I had mine in sandwich form with sausage egg and cheese, rather than cream cheese, since I was really hungry and this was going to serve as breakfast and lunch. Totally fit the bill. I have to say it was a very large amount of food! Bagels here are big! So delicious. Perfect. Coffee good too. Kids were pleased with their plain bagels. Compared to some other places I have seen around the vicinity, reasonably priced. Not a long wait either. I might need to pop over here again before we head out of town!

Line out the door for a reason! My bf and I walked a few blocks in the rain to get some yummy bagels on a Monday morning. The line was long, but it moved pretty fast. We ordered an everything bagel with salmon (lox) spread and a regular bagel with cannoli spread. The bagels are huge and they slap on a ton of cream cheese. SO GOOD. All the seats were taken, even the bar stools by the wall so if you go during the mornings, go early to get a seat. If not, it's a great place to grab and go. Eat and walk :)

I stopped by Brooklyn Bagel and Coffee Co. to get a NY bagel on a layover I had in NYC. There's another bagel place that's closer to the terminal, but I came through on a Sun. when it was closed, so I decided to try Brooklyn instead. Fortunately, my layover allowed sufficient time for me to do so.Wanting to get the most stereotypically NY bagel I could muster, I opted for a salt bagel with lox and a shmear of bacon scallion cream cheese ($12.95). I got it untoasted, given that I wanted to taste the freshness and chewiness of the bagel, and it didn't disappoint. The crumb was dense and chewy, and the outside had a slight crispness, as water boiled bagels do. The cream cheese was applied generously, and there was a nice amount of lox, too. The salt made it taste kind of like a chewy, ring-shaped pretzel, giving it a characteristic sharpness that made the flavors of lox and cream cheese sing.  This was, without a doubt, the most flavorful bagel I've ever eaten!Word to the wise: If you opt for a salt bagel, be sure to have an ample supply of water on hand. By the time I returned to New Haven, I'd consumed all of my water but was still quite parched, and downed another quart as soon as I arrived home. I guess that's the price you pay for all of that flavor!Needless to say, Brooklyn Bagel Co. satisfied my craving for a genuine NY bagel experience. If you're looking for a great bagel and you happen to be in the vicinity, I highly recommend it!

Was lucky that the line for Brooklyn Bagels was not long during our visit. Maybe it was because it was almost 1pm on a Saturday but whatever lol.I ordered the cinnamon raisin bagel with plain cream cheese. It was delicious! They are heavy handed with the cream cheese, but what bagel place is not?My fiance got the whole wheat everything bagel egg sandwich. He said it was good but wish he just stuck with a bagel & cream cheese.Overall - 4 stars! I'll be back.

I love Yelp because it helps me find gold mines like this place! My friend and I were on a day trip to NYC. We wanted to find a local breakfast place near where our bus dropped us off-- there are Starbucks on pretty much every corner but what's the fun in that??We found Brooklyn Bagel & Coffee and on my goodness-- probably one of the best (if not the best) bagel I've had! They have a huge line of different spreads-- different kinds of cream cheeses, lox spread, chicken liver spread, etc. It was interesting to see all the flavors. Their bagels are huge and perfectly chewy and delicious. I went with an everything bagel with bacon scallion cream cheese and a slice of tomato on it. I was in heaven, and at only $6 for a loaded up bagel and coffee, it's definitely a cost-efficient breakfast treat! Luckily my friend and I were able to snag a table to sit down and enjoy it-- the line got very long and people were hovering and scavenging for tables. The eating area isn't very big. Next time I'm in NYC I would gladly come here again!!

Pretty damn good bagel and lox. Generous and thick cream cheese, plentiful salmon, fresh toasted bagels. Huge fan. The place has a nice NY deli vibe too and the guys working it are quite nice. They have a very large selection of other spreads I want to explore in the future.Super busy even early sunday morning at like 8am.

So we passed the line on the sidewalk for Brooklyn Bagel on our walk to Murray's and later in the day after 4P circled back when there was no such line. Perfection! I stopped in to pick up a plain bagel for breakfast the next morning and my boyfriend and I shared an afternoon pumpernickel bagel with cucumber and dill cream cheese. It was fantastic! I only ate about half of my plain bagel the next morning on a bus to the start line of the nyc marathon, but let me tell you this half a bagel surely powered me through that course! So for that I am most grateful to Brooklyn Bagel and whatever is in their water to boast such spectacular carbs for marathon running energy ;)If you aren't in the mood to wait in line, my tip would be save this spot for an afternoon snack and hit em' when there isn't a wait.My boyfriend returned the next morning after dropping me to the Staten island ferry and waited around 10 minutes for an everything bagel with egg and cheddar cheese which he also enjoyed.Enjoy!

I've always avoided this spot because I've walked by and seen lines out the door, but some friends and I finally braved it on a Saturday midday. Yes, it was packed, but the lines moved quickly. Do yourself a favor and have just one friend stand in line for a group of orders, and don't expect to get a seat unless you're feeling very lucky.With that said, the bagels and the "schmears" are very good. I've never seen such a big variety of toppings. I went for the special of the day: a Sriracha honey and bacon cream cheese. I will forever think about it! Plus, they put so much on a bagel, I was able to put it on another bagel the next day. As for bagel quality, these are not my favorite, but they definitely do the trick. I like that they offer multiple sizes and some interesting flavors, like coconut and pumpernickel everything.

Brooklyn Bagel fulfilled my craving for a real bagel before heading back to DC. My sesame bagel with butter and lox was perfect--well toasted, plenty of lox, chewy inside, crunchy outside. There are plenty of bagels to choose from. I didn't care for my mocha latte, which tasted more like hot chocolate, so I wouldn't get a latte here. Long lines are orderly and move quickly. It's close to Penn Station and the bus pick ups if you are heading in or out of town.

Always fresh (if you're lucky, still warm!) selection of bagels. I trekked to New York with the goal of trying the infamous ranbow bagel, but didn't have time to go to Brooklyn to get the real thing. Getting a rainbow bagel here was just as satisfying! I ordered a half dozen rainbow bagels, clearing out the rest of their day's stock at around noon. The colors were super vibrant and unnatural, which is exactly what I expected (and wanted) from the videos I've seen on instagram. While I ordered, a few girls overheard me and tried to order a rainbow bagel too, but I had gotten the last 6. I feel kind of bad about this as I hoarded all the bagels at my seat between me and my friend. To be fair, I was bringing them back to SF.The rainbow bagel kept the same consistency as any normal bagel - just the perfect amount of chewiness without being rubbery or stale, but had an odd scent of sickly sweet fruit loops. At first I thought it was some sort of placebo effect of just seeing rainbow bagels and associating them with something sweet and fruity, but lo and behold, my friends also smelled it, and tasted a more fruity flavor in the bagel dough as well. Still tasted super good with cream cheese though!

Freshly made bagels with every type of schmear imaginable.The weekend morning lines can be absurdly long (like out the door), but these bagels are well worth the wait. This place is also equipped to deal with all the business they get and their service is very efficient. Be prepared - they'll start taking your order before you're even close to the register.I'm all about that thick layer of cream cheese, and this place gets me. They're very generous with the spreads. I would say the final product is 2/3 bagel, 1/3 cream cheese. It's also enormous and very delicious.I prefer savory spreads over sweet ones. My favorite is the jalapeno asiago; it's got quite the zing, so maybe skip it if that's not your thing. The Kalamata feta, sun-dried tomato, and veggit tofu are also up there on the list.I stop by here at least once every time I'm in nyc. I highly recommend it!

It's crazy and you are going to have to waitbut it's worth it. Lox and Chives spread was amazing. Loaded with flavor and dense for a great start to your day. Didn't try the ice coffee but that looked reallly good and will try next time. This thing was oozing with cream cheese which if that's your thing, great, but it was a bit too much for me. Regardless, its new york and bagels yo and this spot is ballin out like melo (too soon).

For being in a touristy area, I think the place deserves a good rating for its bagels. There are so many types to choose from, and the spreads as well. I had a wheat bagel with regular cream cheese and lox. It was delicious, and they weren't stingy with the ingredients.There are places to sit, but as it is in a crowded area, it can be hard to find a seat.
