The first think I have to mention about this place is the service. It cannot be better. Super friendly and nice, professional... Really, it cannot get better! Five stars for them!Regarding the food... Here's what we ordered and what we thought about it:.- Spicy Mang roll: Very good! We really enjoyed. It was fresh and tasty. Very successful roll..- Mighty Mushroom roll: My girlfriend love it. Unfortunately, it didn't quite work for me....- Nutty Buddy wrap: We both agree it was delicious. It delivered freshness and a nice flavor..- Curry Flower wrap: Unfortunately, I can't say the same thing about this one... we couldn't even finish it...I appreciate the originality of their creations. However, some of them didn't completely work for us.

Beyond sushi offers plant based sushi rolls, soups, salads and desserts so "beyond sushi" is right! I tried a starter soup and three rolls. I loved the chili mushroom soup it is spicy and so good! The three rolls I tried were La Fiesta, Sunnyside and Sweet Tree. My favorite was Sunnyside, the sundried tomato really takes over so if you don't like that then you won't like it. Definitely want to try some other items on the menu and will be buying the full size soup!

I came here with my vegan friend and it was just awesome to come to a sushi imitation place where we can order worry free! They don't use imitation fish- just substitute the roll ingredients with other things! We got three rolls, and they were all so tasty! And each roll is very cheap- only 6$. The presentation is so fancy and beautiful that when I first saw pictures of the rolls I thought they were going to be expensive, but don't be intimidated by the pictures, everything is very affordable!! Lol

I ate here after a protest march in September and forgot to write my review sooner. This was on my list of vegan places to try while in Manhattan. I ordered the Mighty Mushroom roll and the Chic Pea roll. All I can say is WOW. This was the BEST vegan sushi I've ever had. One roll would've been enough for me as they are dense and delicious. The Mighty Mushroom was my favorite. Each roll (if you're not eating in-house) comes with it's own tube of sauce which was fun on the train home..lol. I can't wait to go back. I wish there was one in my city.

Love this vegan sushi and Asian food spot. Their lunch combos are pretty awesome. I generally get the roll and dumpling combo and every option I've tried has been delicious, flavorful, fresh and unique. Love their fresh ingredient and the care that goes into making their food. The Fun-guy dumplings and the spicy mango rolls are my top choices.They have some seating and will happily give you a tall bottle of chilled tap water if you ask.

The best veggie sushi I've ever had. I love how creative they get with their sushi using ingredients like mango, picked daikon, sweet potato, mushrooms, carrots, black rice and a ton of sauces.My favorite roll is the spicy mang! Crunchy, savory, spicy, sweet and sour. It's a flavor explosion!Ingredients are always fresh and they used to make the rolls as ordered. At my last visit though, it seemed like they switched to be pre-making and refrigerating the rolls, and then adding the sauces before serving.Service is quick, and staff is friendly! Seating can be a bit of an issue because they only have 3-4 tables, but people are usually in and out quickly.

I'm not from New York, but this is probably the one restaurant that I wish could come back with me. If I were in NY, I'd probably get food from here all the time, no joke. I love all of the different varieties of vegetarian sushi (my favorite is the Mighty Mushroom), and they have plenty of noodle soups/salads, dumplings, and wraps. And all at a great price - what more can you ask??Well actually, probably more seating...it's a really small space, so if you're lucky, you can grab a table but you'll likely be sharing it with other people. If you're a party of one to three, you can also sit at the bar, which is pretty cool because you can watch them make the sushi. I also wish that you were offered water and there was a bathroom, which is particularly inconvenient when you're a tourist (less so if you're a local). So really this is definitely a good place for getting a delicious meal to-go, but just a heads up if you're trying to sit in and eat. Regardless, the food here is SO good, the variety is great, it's relatively cheap, so every time I'm in NY, you will undoubtedly find me at Beyond Sushi at least once!

I've been vegetarian since I was a kid, so I'm well acquainted with standard fishless sushi options-- avocado (ok), cucumber (tasteless), natto (the most repulsive thing I've ever tried to enjoy, but probably an acquired taste), the occasional plum or combo roll (most fine, sometimes weird). Needless to say, sushi is never my first choice. But Beyond Sushi flips the table. I could eat lunch here every week for the rest of my life and still be excited about it each time. Everything looks delicious, but I opted for the Mighty Mushroom and it was amazing! It's the truffle fries of fish-less sushi. It has that powerful umami addictiveness in the sauce with the subtle nuttiness of nori and sushi rice and mushroom pieces. Plus, it's beautifully plated!The lunch specials (sushi + soup/salad/side) save you a dollar or so, but if you didn't want a soup or side salad to begin with that discount isn't really tempting enough to lure you from getting a drink or brownie instead. Or spending $7 on lunch instead of $10.The cucumber lemonade was too sweet for me, but if you're craving something sugary it's not bad. If you're getting it to go, I imagine would also be GREAT 1:1 with seltzer (or a cheeky gin & tonic/seltzer combo).Service is amiable and efficient-- almost too efficient! Our food was ready before two seats had opened up, so we had to awkwardly stand around waiting for someone to leave before eating. There are only a few tables, all fairly small, but it's worth sticking around to eat in. The plating is elegant and the noise level is fairly low. Once you get a seat, it's a great place to eat and catch up with a friend.

This has to be the best tasting sushi I've ever had. I am a recent Vegan whole food plant based eater. As the meat eater that I once was, I thought it'd be extremely difficult to match the tastiness with vegan meals. However, this place has blown me away. This completely destroys this notion, and thinking that animal based foods are far more superior than plant based foods from a taste perspective.My girlfriend and I have been wanting to try this place for quite sometime. We were greeted generously by staff, and were given a menu to explore our options.We ordered the Chick Pea Roll, the Green Machine, and the Sweet Tree. Aside from the sushi rolls being appealing to the eye, the taste is out of this world. My girlfriend and I have come to a consensus that our favorite roll is the Green Machine; from the rice, to the vegetables, to the sweet sauce topping, it all blends well to give this astounding mix of flavor.After reading some other reviews, many people have recommended the Mighty Mushroom as their favorite, so that will be next order. I also ordered their mushroom soup. There isn't much to comment on it, other than that it is really spicy and will fill you up quick. Although the taste wasn't terrible, next time i'll opt out of the soup and order another tasty roll.Please give this play a go if you're passing buy, it is worth every buck. Enjoy!

Beyond sushi = Beyond good! So happy I found this place. It is really tiny inside so you might have to wait if you want to dine in. It was around lunch time and I saw hat they offer lunch specials everyday between 11.30am-3pm. I ordered two of their lunch special take aways, both with the spicy shroom rice paper wrap and with la fiesta and the mighty mushroom sushi rolls. I was pleasantly surprised over how tasty, fresh and full of flavor everything was. Now I kinda want to try all of their dishes! Only negative is that they don't have a restaurant in Queens! I will definitely be back for more of that veggie deliciousness!

Great, unique food for sushi lovers, especially vegan sushi fans! This really satisfies a sushi craving, even though there's no fish involved.It feels like Beyond Sushi is constantly updating and changing their menu. It's great because there's always so many options and creative flavors! Mosttt of the rolls are so delicious and the flavors work perfectly. But I have encountered a couple that just don't work right.. Chic Pea, to me, was too earthy. Not bad (I still ate it :p) but nothing I'd recommend. I highly recommend getting at least one of the dumpling orders! Literally all of the dumpling choices are delicious, but my favorite is Smokey Tom. The rolls and the rice paper wraps are also great (Curry Flower wrap is particular amazing) but I prefer the rolls for truly satisfying the sushi craving.You probably want to order a wrap + roll or 2-3 rolls per person. They have some decent lunch combos that provide the perfect amount of food for good prices.Inside is so cute and lit up with natural light. I love the natural feel inside. It's not the biggest space, but I've never had trouble finding seating.

I've already been to every Beyond sushi and I have to say these places are one of my favorites. This one is tiny but cute, staff was very friendly, smiling and helpful. Food is great and beautifully served. We had sushis, a rice bowl and I also had dumplings which usually are my favorites here - this was delish too but I found something very hard and unchewable in all of the dumplings... I guess it was the peel of the onion (?), anyways, we had a great time and I'm still a huge fan of Beyond Sushi!

My favorite sushi in the whole world!!!The first time I tried this brand was years ago at NYC Veg Fest...I have been hooked ever since!Quality ingredients, consistently fresh, just amazing.Spicy Mang and the Mighty Mushroom are my jam.I could seriously eat a million of these rolls...or any of their rolls and I would NEVER get sick of them!Many different items on the menu...there is something for everyone. Their miso soup hits the spot on a cold cold NYC day!When I order veg sushi anywhere in the world, I always think about Beyond Sushi...And nothing else will ever compare!!!!!

I went into beyond with a friend of mine for lunch I had a really great experience there.Food: The combinations and taste and quality of the food was all amazing. A great approach to vegetarian sushi .Allergies / food accommodations: The staff was super helpful in helping us navigate the menu for any allergies. It was very thoughtful.So why 4/5?The tables were a little small/ chairs were tiny. I'm 6'3 and it felt like I was eating at a kids table/ my knees didn't fit. Also, I don't know if there is a bathroom at the restaurant so that's a -1 for a place with an eat in option.

They moved in across the street from my home and I am so happy they did!Creative, clean, delicious.The staff is always great!Guy the creator chef is a really great guy!punny...I want some of the secrets!Also bring back the date bars!

Vegan sushi? No raw fish? Substitute veggies? Great sushi, for great prices! Really satisfies the craving for sushi! I never even knew vegan sushi existed until one of my friends recently turned into a vegan! I honestly couldn't tell the difference when I ate the sushi! This place has many varieties to choose from and you won't be disappointed. My favorite was Sweet Tree that has a great touch of spicy sauce that adds great flavor. The others that we ordered, were great too, but not much as the Sweet Tree. MUCH RECOMMENDED!!/

This place is pretty awesome. Vegans will definitely love this place. Small place with only 3 long tables and 4 chairs per table, this place is only for a quick bite. Around 6.00 per roll and 8 pieces per roll, it is pretty decent for its price. Staffs were friendly and the food came out very quick. Would be back one day.

Just to be clear, THIS ISN'T SUSHI. As long as you're okay that it's not raw fish, then you can enjoy it as a vegetarian substitute.The location is tiny, but our group of 4 didn't have much trouble finding a seat on a weekday for their lunch special, and the employee actually took our orders from the table since it was hard for us all to have enough room to get up at once.All the food comes presented beautifully. I ended up splitting the mighty mushroom roll and the spicy mango rolls with another person.  The mushroom one is definitely one of their favorites. It is a great option if you like truffle oil, since that flavor is quite powerful. The mango dish was a little lighter, but the spice was just right- not too light.This is a great place for a light lunch meal, if you don't want to be totally stuffed. I went right to a workout class afterwards, so this ended up being perfect. However, if you're starving, it's going to cost a bit more money to be satisfied. Enjoy!

Fishless sushi?! What kind of abomination is this place?! Answer: a very tasty one.As a vegetarian, I'm always jealous when I go out for sushi with seafood eaters. They'll get a special roll with all kinds of cool toppings and funky sauces and I'm stuck with...avocado. No offense to avocado rolls, but they get a bit boring after a while.Beyond Sushi is different. They've got all kinds of unique rolls made with healthy rice, fresh fruits and vegetables, all topped with special sauces and garnishes. A vegetarian sushi lovers paradise!But you don't need to be veg to appreciate the love they put into their food, anyone can enjoy it! Two of their $6.89 rolls will fill you up, which also makes this place wallet-friendly.Downside is there's no bathroom and very sparse seating. This one of those uniquely-NYC, hole-in-the-wall restaurants. So pray one of the 3 tables are open, and cross your fingers that you don't get the urge to pee.Long story short: whether you're veg or not, Beyond Sushi is bomb. Skip the raw fish and try something different for a change. You won't regret it!

Was supposed to be delivered at noon for an office lunch. I called at 12:15PM and they hadn't even started making the order yet because "there was no food in the restaurant". Was finally delivered an hour late but at that point, every one was cranky and starving and had other meeting to go to. Horrible customer service.
Wow. Just wow. Amazing quality, fresh, flavorful ingredients, coupled with fantastic prices and excellent friendly service. Solid 5 stars. Yay vegan food!

Every roll is so detailed but it is a bit more expensive, and if you're looking for that fattiness the fish gives, you wont find them here - these rolls are very lean and healthy. They have SO many options.

I love Beyond Sushi!! I've been to their 14th St. location a couple times and the sushi is very good! The Sweet Tree roll has a nice spicy sauce that adds great flavor. I've also tried the rice paper wraps and I would highly recommend the Nutty Buddy!! My friend's Zen salad looked super good and she was a big fan - I'll have to try it next time. Everything is fresh and healthy. Best of all, the prices are very reasonable for the serving size and quality of food!The location is counter-style, and they have four small tables with about 4 stools at each one. However, you can easily take the food to go and eat in the Union Square area! Try it and don't be scared because it's vegan, you'll be pleasantly surprised!
Small space, but perfect for lunch of small group 2-3 people. The rolls are so delusions! I'm so glad this place exists, as a vegan I can go all out, otherwise I'd miss rolls and sushi.

Extremely yummy vegan sushi!!! Creative plant-based cuisine that is aesthetically pleasing and delicious. The colors of the sushi rolls are stunning. There are so many options to choose from and vegans and non-vegans alike will love these healthy rolls. These ain't your average basic avocado cucumber rolls-- they use black rice, purple rice etc and rolls have ingredients like mushroom, mango, chickpeas. They also have seasonal specials that are always worth a try. Flavor profile on point.I recommend the mushroom roll the most. So much umami flavor. Also the mushroom dumplings are amazing.They recently expanded their menu to have noodles, noodle bowls and dumplings. I still think their strength are their sushi rolls so I would stick to that!This location is pretty small so at busy peak hours you may have to wait a little. You can also just get take out!They have homemade drinks and healthier desserts like black bean sweet potato brownies (it's good but if you don't like that "healthy" brownie taste then stick to a more classic vegan brownie).

Togo lunch combo: Green Machine Roll + Smoky Tom dumpling.The roll was okay.The dumpling was flavorful and interesting. I am Taiwanese so for me most of the time western interpret dumpling is weird. But this one is weird in a good way~

Really good vegan sushi coming from a non vegan. Id'e say its a little bit more exotic that traditional sushi because they use wild rice, cashew dressings and and fruit but its really good.The sushi is colorful and honestly very appealing to the eye and I believe it belongs in a 'plant based' category.I got the mushroom wrap that was filling and creamyI also got the Crunch N Munch roll and the Sweet Tree roll and the Mushroom rollThe place is tiny and gets crowded at times and I find it pricy giving the fact no fresh fish is used and thats why I give it 4/5

I've been to all 3 locations because that's how much I crave this spot. It's so refreshing on a hot day when you just want to eat something's cold. My go-to is the cauliflower curry rice wrap. I ask for the sauce on the side so I can have it with each bite, instead of just the first two or so. There aren't many vegan sushi places in the area, so I'm super thankful for this.

I hate vegan food but the vegan sushi here is actually really good! I came here with my friend for lunch and we both got one of their lunch specials that come with an appetizer and a roll. For the appetizer, I opted for the wild shroom noodle salad and it was really good. It was like eating a healthy version of japchae. I especially liked the sauce that came with it since it had a nice spiciness to it. For the roll I got the Mighty mushroom and it had a very nice creamy texture. I also got to try some of my friend's Spicy mang roll and I think I liked that one more since its a bit more flavorful. The mango gave the roll a slight tartness/sweetness and the sauce on top gave the roll a bit of a kick. The place itself is a hole in the wall and there's only seating for like 10 people. Prices are ok; we paid like $12 for the lunch special and it filled me up. Service was very nice.
I try something new every time I go. The staff is amazingly friendly. The desserts are always great.

It's a really small place, and more like a get in/get out kind of place. Dishes I got:- "spicy mang" sushi roll - It was Definitely the best sushi roll out of the three, it had the right mixture of tangy/sourness from the mango and spiciness of vegetables.- "sweet tree" sushi roll - It contains sweet potato, but nothing really stood out for this roll for me- "pickle me" sushi roll - The idea of pickles in a sushi roll was intriguing, but I think its better in thought than practice. The taste of the pickles overwhelmed any other flavor that could come from the roll.Overall, the rolls were interesting ideas but I wasn't a fan of how they panned out as a dish. It was also disappointing that all the ingredients in the rolls were all slightly cold, so the rolls tasted... cold. The temperature dulled out a lot of the flavors.I also got the spicy ramen mushroom bowl and that was the opposite of the sushi rolls. It was definitely not cold. The dish was roaring with heat, temperature and spice level. Dare i say, a little to much "roar", with not much noodles or vegetables in the bowl.The experience was underwhelming.

5 stars for creativity. I absolutely love this place since they are the only vegan sushi restaurant in the city. This location is on the small side so be warned. There's about 3 small tables, so if you dine in just keep that in mind. The rolls are always fresh, and delicious. I'm really fond of their creativity with the menu. The mango, pickle and mushroom sushi are my faves to date. My only "beef" is that they changed their menu recently and that they got rid of the combos. I was a big fan of the combos, one of the better things they've chopped off the block.I can't wait to see what they will do in the future! I'm still and will always be a big fan :)
Favorite sushi in the world. I used to eat fish sushi, and this is literally better. Way to go, Beyond Sushi!

I'm not vegetarian nor am I vegan. Was intrigued by their colorful sushi so I came here to try it out. Not only is the food here aesthetically pleasing, but also pleasing to the palate. The soups were surprisingly filling on their own.White miso: I am usually not a fan of miso soup, but theirs was very delicious.Chili mushroom: Sweet and spicy. Loved it.Sweet tree sushi roll: It's sushi alright. Yum!Spicy shroom rice paper wrap: Packed with flavor.Would definitely recommend this to everyone regardless if they're vegan, vegetarian, or neither. Will also come again soon to try other things on their menu.

Such a pleasure going to a sushi joint that is fishless and makes ordering easy for people who avoid animal-based products.Anything a vegan wants, a vegan can have. Thank you, Beyond Sushi!Craving spiciness, I went with the bowl of chili mushroom soup and the spicy mang roll.The chili mushroom soup was VERY spicy. Loved the cilantro and enoki mushrooms, but I can't put my finger on the spice in the soup that wasn't my favorite. I kept eating it though, so obviously I enjoyed it overall!The spicy mang roll had no spice - but that could be because I had the firey soup just minutes before. It was a very fresh roll, that unfortunately kept falling apart on me. So good though!!Even better - the lunch special for these two was highly affordable!
I am not a vegan. Everything looks really good and tastes fresh. However, I'll be sticking to real sushi. This just wasn't for me.

I went here eons ago when I lived on 14th street, but I remember really liking it. I do prefer regular sushi compared to this and tend to avoid any healthy helping of fruits/veggies. This could be an exception if I ever decide to be healthy. It's a very tiny place but luckily my friend and I scored a table since it wasn't too busy. This is a very interesting concept and a unique take on vegetarian sushi. I'm not a huge fan, but I can imagine vegetarians loving this place. The spicy mang was definitely the best roll when I went here. Give it a try!

Great sushi, noodles and dumplings. No death involved.My friend loves this place and took me here. I'm not a fan of sticky sushi rice but the black rice they serve is a revelation. We both ordered the Pickle Me sushi roll and it was wonderful. You don't really need to dunk it in soy sauce because it's that good. My friend also had the Smokey Tom dumpling which I tried and surprisingly liked. And I also ordered the Wild Shroom noodle bowl. Oh em gee, I command you to order the Wild Shroom bowl! I had to hold my friend off from taking more.Even when I used to eat seafood, I felt guilty that so much fish that isn't wanted is thrown back dead. No guilt here though, just great made-to-order food. The negative comments here didn't apply to us. Try it for something different and not corporate.

My first experience at Beyond Sushi was at the Chelsea Market and I didn't think anything could top that- until I came to this location! The food is consistently delicious and fresh, but whereas the Chelsea Market is your grab and go type place, this location, though small, offers a more sit down and enjoy atmosphere similar to a sushi bar. We started with dumplings- the Smoky Tom and The Badge. The Smoky Tom was just okay, but The Badge- mind blown! Explosion of flavors, amazing texture and all around delicious. I could have had at least two more orders of those dumplings! Sushi rolls we had the Spicy Mang which we didn't think the food could get any better until we tried our other sushi roll: Sweet Tree. You won't even miss fish in your sushi the flavors are so fresh, full and amazing here. Must try for anyone who is vegan or not that loves sushi!Favorites:The Badge DumplingsSpicy MangSweet Tree

LOVE this place. For vegan sushi, this place is phenomenal. I really like how expertly prepared each roll is and how unique the elements of each roll are. A number of the rolls come with little sauces that add flavor and creamy texture. If you order to go, you get those sauces in mini plastic squeeze bottles so you can customize how much sauce you want on each bite.For one of the rolls, they even charred the top with a torch which I thought was a really nice touch and added a "roasted" element that I was not expecting. I'm also a fan of their green tea noodles but there so much more to try and I'll definitely be back for more!

I was starving around 9:13 after a long day at work, really wanted some soup since weather is getting a bit chilly. Walked in. Staff was very nice. The food is amazing. So without hesitation I added to my book mark. I LOVE sushi. This going to be my another fav place in NYC.

As soon as I walked in the door, I knew this place was different from any other I've been to. The staff is beyond perfect, the ambiance is relaxing and clean at the same time. A lot of space, but something is missing: salmon.

This place is so my jam! I haven't had sushi in so long because I took fish out of my diet for good. I had the smokey tom dumpling with the chic pea roll. With the lunch special still being in effect on a Saturday afternoon, I was pleasantly delighted. I wanted more of that smokey tom dumpling because of that tahini sauce - also how could you go wrong with squash in your dumpling? I loved the chic pea roll because of the eggplant and tahini! I never knew how much I missed the flavor of wasabi either. I will def be coming back to try more of these healthy choices!
Incredible options. Had the zany carrot salad and had to slow down while eating because it was so good.

This whole concept is Very Confusing for a Carnivore of my kind, VEGAN Sushi yet somehow I find myself in here.Small little joint doing something different, guess thats the selling point here. What it is, is your Sushi Rolls minus the good part (fish) but yet its the combination of flavors the entice you. I got the ever raved "Spicy Mang" and "Mighty Mushroom" and I must say I was surprised sort of by the whole package.Might Mushroom is but Quinoa Salad tightly wrapped into a roll to say the least.Spicy Mang is a take on Spicy Tuna I guess.I am still confused and have mixed feeling, will I come back No never, why you ask ? CAUSE, I'll take that Tuna and Salmon Please.Should you go here, it definitely is a one time visit yes you should.Verdict - Let leave the whole Veganism to the "LIKE OMG I am VegAn, Like I care for the PlAneeet" West Coasters seriously i still cant wrap my head around this one

Beyond Sushi is an vegetarian sushi bar, which puts a spin on traditional sushi.Before deciding to try this place, I was not sure if I would like it. The main reason why I love sushi in the first place is that it's made with my favorite seafood. I went ahead and decided to try it anyways---what a good decision.I ordered the Sweet Tree Roll ($7) which is 8 pieces of rice, avocado, sweet potato and sprouts. It all was amazing, especially the sauce they topped it with. So good, (and still so hungry) I ordered a second roll set. No shame.Beyond Sushi made me a believer in good vegetarian food, especially when it comes to sushi. They had a lot of other great options that I'm now excited to try. It wasn't that expensive either! Plus, they're on seamless so makes sushi more convenient than ever.

Whenever I'm in the 'hood I get vegan sushi at Beyond Sushi. This meal I got Smoky Tom dumplings, sweet bean rice paper wrap and seaweed salad. The first two dishes were tasty and (especially the dumplings) deliciously different. The seaweed salad was fine but not up to par with the other dishes. Still and all whenever I'm in the hood, I'm getting vegan sushi at Beyond Sushi.
Great service, friendly staff, deliciously flavored food...wide variety of vegan options. I wish there was one in California!

Vegan or not, everyone should try this place. You wouldn't even miss meat or fish here. Their dishes actually keep you full and they're healthy! I'm a hugeeeee sushi fan and I love me some salmon, but this place is so good for a healthier alternative. They also have a good selection of salads, soups, and dumplings as well.I've tried all of their rolls, but my favorites are the mighty mushroom and the spicy mango. I feel like they are the most unique. The others are just plain flavored, but still delicious (also I'm in love with mushrooms).Today I tried all of their dumplings for the first time and I loved them all. They were filling and flavorful.The 14st location is pretty small, so don't try coming in with a large group of people and expect to get seats. It's perfect for just 2-3 people. 4 might even be a struggle.I was really eyeing the spicy mushroom chili soup, but it was so humid today. I'll definitely come back to give their soups a try.

Unreal, phenomenal, fantastic. This is the most flavorful healthy food being offered in NYC today...bringing vegetables to a WHOLE new level!!! Game changer -- simply the very very best and the most creative vegan menu EVER!Highly Recc; Curry Soup and Sampler Sushi Plate. But truly, even the top Chef's in NYC could learn a thing or two from whomever created this glorious menu.

The vegan sushi is delicious and healthy. I ordered the mighty mushroom and it was flavorful. The mushroom and tofu went well with the sauce inside. I would come here again and order the lunch special for a bigger portion.

Came here after a day of exploring MoMA, anxious to feed my growling stomach. My friends decided on this place (due to certain limitations and preferences within the group). One ordered the sushi rolls (as pictured - I believe it was the Mighty Mushroom), while the others ordered salads (Jolly Onion and Wild Shroom) with an order of dumplings (Smokey Tom) to share. They seemed to thoroughly enjoy theirs, which was great!However, due to my hunger, I chose to order a bowl of hot noodles. I was attracted to the prospects of the Green Root, but it seemed a bit small. And so, I chose the green tea soba noodles paired with a chili-based, mushroom-filled soup - suggested by the cashier as a good combination. Once it arrived, I regretted my decision almost immediately.There were barely any noodles and mushrooms; in fact, the salad noodles had the same amount of noodles as mine, but at a $3.50 cheaper cost. In addition, the soup was overbearing and a horrible pairing with the noodles. All the green tea taste was covered.I finished my meal feeling extraordinarily unsatisfied and disappointed. This goes to show why I'd never go for vegan sushi again!

Same fantastic food as the other locations. I don't think you can go wrong with any menu choice but the ramen soups are delicious. No restroom and limited place to sit to be prepared to take out or wait a bit for a seat. Food is prepared fresh but fast. Lovely friendly staff.

After reading all the reviews and hearing from friends I wanted to give this place a shot with my vegan friend. Very very small seating space for lunch rush so we did take out of 3 different sushis to share I cant say that they were all yummy but I really enjoyed the mushroom it had such good flavor. Its a good option if you are in the area and need a quick bite just grab and go!

This review is for the carnivores the picky eaters...both of which I am. I stopped in here for lunch today with my vegan friends and I was a little nervous about the whole endeavor, as I am pretty particular with what I eat. No bread, ground beef, cheese, sugar? Where's the fun in that?! Well I was so wrong. This place was amazing!!! I got the sunny side up and the sweet tree and they were both absolutely delicious. Then I went back later in the day to get some to take home and I saw that they had a sweet potato black bean brownie. I was intrigued so I decided to give that a go and it was out of this world! Truly delicious, moist, and not overwhelmingly sweet. The staff was also very nice both times I was in there. I recommend this to everyone, but especially to the non believers. Try it

This place is awesome! I would eat here everyday if I could. Quick service, delicious food and all vegetarian!! Only con is their limited seating space. I'd recommend the spicy mang roll- excellent flavor, mildly spicy and super fresh.

Very good for a vegan take on sushi (and some other stuff). Would I necessarily pick this over the original (non-vegan) versions? At the end of the day, probably not (except for the spicy shroom wrap - which I would eat any day). But it's a great option if you're looking for something different (or have vegan friends).The lunch specials are great, as I was able to try:Smokey Tom - A bit disappointing, reminded me of a pierogi. Not bad, I'm just not a huge fan of pierogies.Spicy shroom rice paper wrap - My favorite thing. These were so good, packed with umami flavor and bit of spiciness to add some oomph, with some nice crunch from the cashews.Mighty Mushroom - I liked this roll a lot more than the spicy mang. It had more flavors thanks to the umami from the mushroom.Spicy Mang - Lacked some of the savoriness that I would have liked (felt still a bit bland to me). Also felt like the rice was a bit too vinegar-y (same issue with the mighty mushroom, but vinegar flavor was more prominent with the spicy mang, perhaps because the other flavors were less prominent).Only thing is that this spot is tiny and seats are very limited (essentially 3 tables plus seats at the bar).

Looked amazing from the photos and I needed to try it!Got the 4 piece sampler and it was excellent. Didn't add soy sauce and very much enjoyed it.Ordered the spicy mushroom wrap and it was delicious until I hit a huge piece of plastic. It was so disappointing and it ruined the meal. Then I found another piece of plastic in the food.I wasn't impressed with the staff.Sorry guys, you're profitable but you get reviews like this when you fail.

One of those places you're partly reluctant to rate well, and then have to share. But I'm slowly getting around to most of the popular ice-cream and gelato places in the city and this definitely holds its own. True, not a tonne of flavors, and odd combinations, but if you want experimental ice-cream - plenty of that downtown. What they do do, they do very well. I love the salted caramel crumble, the matcha is really nice and my favorite is the rose water which I haven't found anywhere else and is well done and reminiscent of faluda and other rose syrup delights from back home in the east. I ate A LOT of gelato in Italy, and ok, I'm not an expert but this stuff is pretty solid :)Unlike the other fancypants places (and they are fancy, I was practically sitting on top of Anna Sui at another village favorite last Friday) there aren't obnoxious lines, and it's a really lovely space, with seating plus coffee and other snacks. Honestly its refreshing to duck in here and site and not be bothered and pretend you're far away from the craziness of the city. The service is great, let you annoy them and try everything and are very patient. Oh and they let you do two flavors in the small size - and it's a very respectable serving, more than enough to satisfy a craving and way more than some of the micro scoops you get in Little Italy (not mentioning any names ;) Prices comparable to the other artisanal places and frankly you're getting gelato, which for some odd reason I feel like is superior to regular ice-cream, but that's just me. Texture is usually creamier/heavier. Anyway try it, cos why not?

I've been running out of ice cream places to try in the city (shocking right?!), but I stumbled upon Fresco Gelateria on Yelp! The great reviews and the unique flavors immediately captured my attention. The staff was really friendly and kept asking if there was anything we wanted to try. I tried the salted crumble and the rose water and ended up ordering a double ($5.50) of the fior di latte and ferrero.The gelato was just alright. The texture was too soft for my liking. After a few minutes of sitting inside, there was already a nice pool of melted gelato. Not sure how it would hold up against the New York summers. The flavors, while interesting, did not shine through. Each one that I tried had a very subtle taste of whatever flavor it was mixed with an almost artificial or stale taste.Overall, Fresco Gelateria is just alright. The staff is friendly and perhaps the other food items are good, but in terms of gelato, there are definitely better places in the city.

The vibes, customer service, and most importantly the GELATO here are all amazing.My favorite flavor is the matcha with brown rice. It is bomb af.Ive tried other flavors such as the salted caramel, Ferrero rocher, and the rosewater, and they are all really really good too.Love this place!!

I've never actually had gelato here. Instead, this is my backup brunch place when Veselka's or Orlin inevitably have a wait. The menu here is full of yogurts, porridges, salads, and pastries, and the interior is attractive enough that you can fool yourself into thinking you meant to come here.On my most recent visit, I went for a chia pudding. It came out swiftly, topped with slices of banana. Unfortunately, the apple puree was a little too dominant, and it felt like I was eating a fancy bowl of apple sauce rather than all of the other delicious ingredients.I recommend their lentil salad and their lassi, as well as their tasty teas. I hope to make it back soon for gelato!

Wide variety and open late! As a freelancer, my hours vary so I ran in here to get some work done at 8pm on a Thursday and they were open with free wifi. The staff was friendly and they had ample seating.

Dessert: we got the Ferrero and stracciatella gelato. The ferrero tasted just like a ferrero rocher and the stracciatella was a nice light vanilla with chocolate shavings. The gelato had a nice texture and was very flavorfulPrice: around 6 dollars for two scoops in s cupService: the server was very patient when we took a while to pick the flavors we wanted. She also let us taste a few flavors before decidingOverall, this was a great place. The atmosphere of the place is cozy and trendy. I would definitely come back again!

Went here with a friend to grab a bite of something sweet after lunch.After trying a couple of flavors, I decided to go with a scoop of the chocolate sorbet. The sorbet was very rich and flavorful and definitely satisfied my sweet tooth.Overall, this place serves up some great flavors and has friendly wait staff to boot.

They do not have a lot of flavors but you don't need it. Cause they all yummy.They have different biscuits/cookies by the counter/register and you can buy them on the side and dig them into your gelato.I had the cookies and cream and paired with chocolate biscuit and butter waffle biscuit!
They had great, flavorful options. If you like Ferraro rocher definitely get that flavor.

Finally got to try this place! I was very impressed.ATMOSPHERE: Inside is pretty "spacious" for New York standards. There are outlets, tables, benches etc. and free wifi if you know the password. You can see the display of pastries and baked goods and then the area with the gelato.FOOD: Although the pastries all looked good, I came here for the gelato. They have a good amount of dairy and non-dairy/sorbet flavors. The ones with stars means it's sorbet.ROSE WATER - I love rose flavored things, so I already knew I was going to get this one. It has a slight lychee taste to it but is very refreshing. A single scoop really feels like 2 scoops because they fill the cup then fill the top with another scoop (but I dont think you can get 2 flavors like at other gelato places). The texture is icy, which I love. The flavor isn't overpowering but if you dont like floral or rose flavors, you probably won't like it.Overall, very impressed and the consistency was just what I wanted.

It's such a little tiny hidden gem. The gelato here is fairy, light, just like cloud meting in your mouth. I love the rose water flavor best, it's like a perfume in my mouth for the whole day, sweet floral scent makes you feel summery and delightful. Well done! The lady behind the counter was so friendly and warm-hearted, I would come back every time visiting East Village.

Favorite gelato place in the city. Good atmosphere. Very chill. Highly recommend the caramel flavor. Have had the stracciatella as well which was quite good. The medium size was a lot. Could have went with the small and still gotten two flavors with a substantial amount.

The gelato here is delish! They have rotating flavors so come back in different seasons to try new stuff. I haven't had a bad gelato here yet. I'm also a huge fan of the set-up. There's a bunch of nooks and cozy crannies where you can chill and enjoy your gelato in peace. Fresco Gelateria projects an sense of calm which is rare in NYC.I particularly like their chocolate chip/chocolate. Last time I had a really great basil lemon flavored gelato. Pro tip: you can get up to two flavors in the smallest size. Mix and match wisely!Summer is just around the corner and Fresco Gelateria should be one of your go-to's for a refreshing dessert.

So I'm just going to give you a list of flavors, orders will follow:Lemon Poundcake poppy seed flavorRosewaterSmoked ice creamBananaSalted caramel crumbleNow go to fresco, walk up to the guy at the front, and ask him about the smoked flavor. He needs to bring it back. Now that that has been accomplished, make your way to the ice cream display place, and demand to try every flavor on this list. Once that's off the list, proceed to order every single one. Also, those chocolate rolled wafer things have the most awesome flakey texture and yummy chocolate flavor. Now that you have your marching orders, what are you waiting for? Get on it!

I came in here around 5 pm Thursday because a local church gave me a gift card for a free scoop of gelato in appreciation fir volunteering.Considering the oppressive heat Thursday it was a good a day as any to use it.I went in and I looked at all the flavors, many of which are not everyday flavors. I chose the salted caramel. The scoop was pretty generous. The cashier and server had no problem honoring the gift card. It is definitely a place I would return to.

What a lucky incident that 16 Handles ran out of my favorite flavors today; otherwise I would've just had another overly sweet cup of frozen yogurt - but not tonight! I am SO glad we tried fresco, it was a true delight! I had the Salted Crumble and Strawberry, but really all their flavors liked absolutely delicious and yes, they let you mix two flavors in one scoop! Definitely the best ice cream I've had in the area so far!

Who wants gelato? I do I do! Well, that's more accurate for my ice cream-loving girlfriend. She learns well and got to Yelping a place a few weekends ago in NYC. So, once in the big apple, we headed on down to fresco and enjoyed some quality gelato love. Onward!This hip spot has that casual lowercase name on the awning and nothing more. Enter and it's like a little coffee shop, except this place also dabbles in the creamy dessert. It was pretty hoppin' when we entered, but like many gelato joints we were able to sample a few small spoons worth of flavors. There were classic choices like chocolate, vanilla, and strawberry, but there were also a few more unique ones in cucumber and lemon basil. I sampled the latter of those two and it was refreshingly awesome.Despite this, my go to tiramisu was the final decision. A little strong in flavor, but definitely tasted like it was made with detail. The gelato gal got two scoops and split it between stracciatella and matcha. An odd combo, though each one held some great, sweet taste. It wasn't the cheapest dessert endeavor, but that's what you get for the city.Overall, fresco is the fresh fix of gelato that is worthy of a stop in if you catch yourselves nearby. For the gelato gal, she was quite pleased, and that's a good thing!

Very solid gelato. A single scoop typically garners you a very hefty scoop and a half. Great texture to it.I love the assortment of flavors. From rocherro, to rose water..the selection is eclectic and offers very unique tastes. I love trying new and different flavors!Docked a star because i frankly think the place has a strange, out of place odor as soon as you enter.

I've lived a couple of blocks from Fresco for a year now and only just tried it for the first time! Popped by today as I was walking around the neighborhood and sampled the "salted crumble" and the Ferrero flavors. Both tasty but I'm a big fan of salty-sweet pairings, so I went with the salted crumble. Not cheap at $4.50, but obviously high-quality and delicious - and they pack a lot of gelato into the small cup (which was great until I got outside and it started melting onto my hand).They also have about as many sorbet flavors as they do gelato, so still worth a visit for the dairy-averse! Definitely worth a stop by if you're in the area. I'll probably be back.
Their vegan flavors are incredible- great variety. Pina colada is so so good, but my favorite is their chocolate! SO tasty! The shop itself is super cosy. Downside: no public restroom.

I was here on a double date with friends and we stopped by after dinner around East Village. One of our friends was raving about this spot being his favorite gelato place.Now, I can see why after enjoying the delicious matcha gelato. The matcha flavor is strong and I definitely recommend trying it if you're a matcha flavor. I'll have to come back to try the different flavors.

Another sour delivery from Uber Eats.I'm in serious VOM (vomit) mode. I hate writing bad reviews, I really do. And I hate writing this review in particular because this is a gelato place I have yet to try. I decided to order avocado toast for breakfast again because I left my avocado in the fridge. -insert sad face-Take a look at my photo. Go on. Please tell me I'm not crazy and that does NOT look like avocado toast. What it looks like is old guacamole they dished out behind the back of a fridge and tried to cover with parmesan cheese. YUCK.I checked out other images on the Yelp and on Uber Eats and it sure did NOT look like that.Utterly disappointed. My stomach is in crisis mode.I'll need to update this review when I actually try their gelato. Def not ordering Uber Eats from here again.

We stumbled upon Fresco Gelateria on our way out from a restaurant and almost didn't even go in. I was so tired but my husband said, "we need to go inside just for a second so I can see what flavors they have" which led me to get a sweet treat!I personally like the taste of rose flavored things so I sampled the Rosewater & also the Salted Crumble. Ended up getting a small cup with half & half of those. The gelato consistency was really smooth & the flavors were spot on. My husband, who shakes his head whenever I get Salted Caramel flavored things, even enjoyed the Salted Crumble flavor.All in all, a good find for us! While they have gelato, I saw they also offer coffees, teas, sandwiches, and salads. Super cute place, I'd recommend stopping into if you're in the area.

Wow. I passed this spot on the way to the dentist and promised myself I could have some to treat myself afterwards.What a great way to ruin my dinner. Amazing flavors and they let me sample the flavors to my hearts content.Great friendly service and amazing REAL gelato. Delicious.I didn't have any but the coffee looked excellent too.

I came here for breakfast after yoga class. The breakfast menu has many healthy (oatmeal, frittatas), unhealthy (pastries), and somewhere in between (bagels) options. It was hard to choose what to get because everything sounded great. I got a frittata with zucchini, caramelized onions, and goat cheese, served with roasted tomatoes and a salad. The frittata was delicious. My only critique would be, I wish it came with potatoes or homefries instead of the roasted tomatoes, because I was not full after eating. I finished wanting more. I also had a latte with almond milk, which was tasty.Staff is friendly. Prices are standard for the area. It's a cute, quaint spot, with a European feel. I'll definitely be back.

Great East Village gelato shop- good vibes, spacious interior, and lovely product display. I got a single stracciatella cone and it was huge and delicious.One thing for improvement: list all major ingredients of the baked goods. I bought a muffin labeled "peanut butter chocolate chip muffin" and bit in and it had banana so I couldn't eat the rest. Wish they would have advertised it was a banana muffin and then I would've purchased something else.Overall: I'll be back to try more gelato!
Generally excellent in all aspects. The peanut butter and chocolate sorbettos are incredible and a great option for vegans who want an ice cream experience.

Another trip to NYC, another dessert stop at Fresco!Not as smooth as I remember, but still one of the best gelato I've had in the states. If you get 2 scoops, they fill about 70% of the container with the first flavor and you get much less of the second one.I got the Rosewater & Ferroro - both great, goes well together, but I got too much of the Rosewater and the balance was off. The Dark Chocolate would've been even better with the Rosewater!3.5 stars:PeachLemon Poppy4 stars:RosewaterMatcha4.5 stars:Ferrero5 stars:Dark Chocolate
Second chance here ---still shitty attitudeCompared to other place,It's not that great.

R. is in the building.you gel'in? then Fresco Gelateria might be your place.tbh, never had the Gelato and pastries here.my skinny fat (or fat skinny) friends swear by the eats here.me? i've only had the iced coffee. Americano with ice cubes. not a rocket science drink, but solidly good. solid brew. not super strong. not weak though. haven't had the match here. will soon.thought the intention of FG is not to be a home-away-home office. folks do that bc of the free wifi, h20, and relatively good prices on coffee. it's definitely a place folks sponge wif during the day. nighttime is more casual catchup with friends or after-dinner-dessert dates.the decor is bright, clean, and mod. some retro finishes here and there. not a lot of clutter. and a fair amount of seating options. space is large than it looks from the outside.sooner or later people will start taking their posed posed baby + ice cream shots here or Pokemon Go pics...eff that fartbaggery.til then, it's a cute spot for coffee, tea, or gelato.drops mic bc i CONE not resist good desserts!i out.zzz

Don't be fooled by the name - Fresco Gelateria is more than a gelato shop. It's actually a cafe as they have a full blown out food and drink menu. I've always seen Fresco Gelateria from afar whenever I'm in the St. Marks area and it's always looked like a small shop to me, but it's actually quite large and spacious with plenty of seating!Generous with samples (portion and no limit on number of samples - aka the best for indecisive people like me), I got to taste the salted crumble, cookies and cream, ferrero, and another flavor that I can't seem to remember. All were really good that it made my decision for 2 flavors difficult. However, I ultimately went with the cookies and cream and salted crumble, which was caramel gelato topped with pie crusts - yum!$5.50 got me a generous amount of both flavors. I love how there was plenty of pie crusts / cookies in EVERY bite! Fresco Gelateria, you're easily one of the best gelato I've had. Though I've discovered you a tad bit late, I'm so glad I finally walked inside!

Fresco is a relaxed, low-key gelato shop with some hard-to-find flavors like lemon poppy, salted crumble. After trying those flavors (and their basil gelato), I got a scoop of the lemon poppy and a scoop of the ferrero flavored gelato. I got an ample portion of both, and when it started melting, it dripped onto the table so I had a napkin on hand to catch that creamy goodness!Both flavors went well together and tasted great at the same time to my tastebuds. The Lemon Poppy gelato stood out to me, because there were chunks of lemon flavored bread / chocolate / a dense treat inside the gelato, which made its texture so interesting. Its zesty flavor went beautifully with the subtler, nuttier taste of the ferrero (rocher) gelato.I like that a lot of natural light came into the eatery because the front window is all glass. The small details of Fresco's interior decorations-- a small brown clay pot, a large glass dispenser of drinking water, and wooden paddles-- help create a lighthearted, calm vibe.
LOVE this place and come here all the time for my frequent gelato cravings. Great decor, great gelato, great ambiance, what more could you want?

Friendly staff and must try gelato!! It's a cute little place to relax for a bit for busy bodies.I love the rose gelato, I always get it when I come so I would say it is a must try! Other flavors are also yummy and some are great to satisfy your sweet tooth as well.If you want somewhere to sit for a bit and sip on some coffee or catch up with a friend in a quiet environment this is the place! The feel of the place is very cozy but there isn't a lot of seats but it's still worth a visit.

A cool and cozy place to chill and relax! Not only do they have unique flavors of gelato like rosewater but they also have great seating, eco friendly spoons, free water and stylish music. A great place to enjoy a summer afternoon.

Most celebrated ice cream and Gelato spots don't stay open till midnight, Fresco Gelateria does.I got here a half an hour before they close, tasted a few flavors, and decided to go for the salted crumble and the lemon basil. Both were really soft and delicious. Something that I noticed, is that it didn't melt as fast as other ice cream/Gelato parlors.I really liked that they had a seating area, I'll definitely be back for more.

Personal favourites: Earl Grey - perfect level of sweetness, not too creamy and light feel. Must try if you r very into drinking tea. lemon poppyseed is good too. The lemon mojito is like the lemon mint drink, sorbet-ish, not too creamy, sour and refreshing. They change flavours once in a while.Decor in minimalistic style, perfect place for working/studying with free wifi. The coffee is ok. One of the few cute little places with nice ambience that you can work in without going to Starbucks.
I love going here for their ferrero gelato. I tried their peach yogurt today and it was really refreshing.

Hey, this place has some kick ass vegan sorbet. Stooooop it. Stop right there. I know what you're thinking: Vegan gelato? Snooze. Nope! They had SIX sorbets: Chocolate, peanut butter, strawberry, peach, basil lemonade and some fruity mix (mango, pineapple and something else that I forgot). I tasted all but the last one and they were all creamy, flavorful, and sweet--but not "my tongue feels gross" sweet. No coconut taste (unlike Van Leeuwan down the street). And! It's $4.50 for a sizeable cup. And! They let you mix two flavors. And! The worker bees are super friendly and mellow. Not pretentious at all. (All of the above: UNLIKE VAN LEEUWAN). I also had an onion tomato galette and it was super tasty. Get in there!

I Love Fresco Gelateria!This place serves really good gelato. I was there with friends and tried few of their signature flavors. Some of my favorites include:1. Matcha Green Tea2. Peach Yogurt (Must get!!)3. Lemon Basil (My new discoverty)4. Plum WineIt is very cozy place and they serve coffee too. I would come here even during winter time.

Great gelato! Fresco is serving some awesome gelato. They have a good variety of flavors from the traditional strattaciella to flavors like peanut butter. Their gelato has the best texture of any gelato I've ever had. It's smooth and it doesn't leave behind that oily/buttery feel in your mouth. She mouthful is clean and leaves no oily feeling behind. It's the right temperature where the gelato won't melt too fast yet it's still soft enough that you're not having to lose the top layer of your tongue to lick it or biting the scoop. You can have a single scoop served in a cup or a cone. We went for the cone. The waffle cone itself was great, no complaints.Our flavors: salt caramel & FerraroThe salt caramel was so good. Gelato was smooth with strong caramel flavors and not overly salty. It had chunks of toffee to give it some added texture.Ferraro flavor was also great. Smooth chocolate and hazel nut flavor.Definitely come try the gelato of you are in the area!

The gelato was alright. Maybe it would be good to other people who haven't had actual gelato from Italy, but to me at least, wasn't too impressive. Had the strawberry gelato and was pretty sugary and the texture wasn't really "smooth"--not sure how to exactly describe that lol. But if you're a tourist, you'll probably like it. It a single cup for .50

Cute gelato shop with delicious gelato! It's a great alternative to bars or cafes. The service is wonderful (we asked to try different flavors and for recommendations), and the portions are well worth it.

This is one of my favorite gelato places in the city. The gelato is made with made with quality ingredients that you can really taste in each bite. There is also a wide variety of not-so-typical flavors like rambas (made with lychee, mango, pineapple, basil), goat cheese, rosewater, and salted caramel crumble. The staff is always friendly and willing to let you try several flavors. Fresco also has a good selection of coffee/tea drinks and a few pastry items. The space is very calming and open with a few tables; it's not a noisy or cramped coffee house.

Came here for the rosewater gelato hype. Ended up liking the other flavors more.I loved the fig and pear flavors! I like mixing the rosewater flavor with another because it's a bit strong by itself. Really refreshing.Also, very reasonable price at $4 a scoop for two flavors. Will definitely be back to try more flavors. Maybe a more creamy flavor next time.

Lemon poppy gelato was the best lemon gelato or sorbet that I've ever had, and I've lived in Rome and tried many.Amazing serving sizes. Triple scoop is huge and only $7. Great value.Let us try 4 different flavors.Server did mistake 1 of our flavors but no matter because they're all great.

I love everything from the coffee, the breakfast, and the vibe. This is a perfect place for a light breakfast in a quiet place. I love coming here on weekend mornings and usually get a cappuccino and their maple granola bowl - which is layered with granola, fresh fruit, yogurt, and honey. They also have refreshing gelato with flavors like lemon basil and raspberry.

I wasn't sure what I wanted to rate this place. The place is really cute. It's more a coffee shop than an ice cream parlor. They also offer food other than gelato. I had the frittata and a matcha latte. They were both just meh. The matcha latte was too thick, but then again, it seemed to be the guy's first day as he didn't even know how to pronounce "matcha" yet.I've been back twice for the gelato since they close at midnight. The first time I got the Ferrero Rocher flavor since it seemed to be the most popular on Yelp. It did, indeed, taste just like those chocolates, but I was severely disappointed to find out that he consistency was not that of gelato, but just plain old ice cream :( It's not thick and creamy enough to be gelato. I came back and got the salted crumble, which I really liked, even though I'm not exactly sure what the crumble is. I sampled the matcha flavor, and it tasted exactly like matcha. Overall, they have some really good and unique flavors here, but it really isn't gelato.

Anytime I'm near Saint Marks Place, I go to Fresco. The gelato here is very flavorful yet not too sweet. I love the rose water flavor but some people hate it because it reminds them of soap. You can get 2 flavors in one scoop!

Small place, usually slightly busy but I've always managed to grab a seat when I did go. They have outlets near the back bench wall and free wifi! I've tried several of the gelato flavors and I can honestly say they are all very yummy! My favorite is certainly the rose water flavor but the salted crumble and strawberry sorbet were also fantastic.

Fresco is a hidden gem in the east village with hefty ice cream scoops AND vegan ice cream (for this girl)! The cone was pretty good and the gelato was great. Matcha and cookies and cream flavors were so good. Must try for gelato in the east village!

Huh. You know, I really wanted to love Freco Gelateria given the positive reviews more or less across the entire spectrum, and while it may have been because I came in on the late side, the gelato that I had really was pretty easily trumped by a lot of the other gelato and ice cream I've had in the city (M'o Gelato, Van Leeuwen, etc.)Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?I will say that while the product was sub-par in my opinion, the atmosphere at Fresco was excellent. The shape of the place is a bit unorthodox, but it allows for seating whether it's just you looking to get some work done while you enjoy a frozen treat or if you've a full group in tow. The display is beautiful and the gelato itself displayed in a really unique manner. Star Granted.Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?$5.50 is about right for two scoops these days, and that's what I paid at Fresco, opting for Chocolate Brownie and Salted Caramel. Star Granted.Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?Honestly? It just wasn't that great. Both of my flavors were quite a bit more frozen than gelato should be, and the result was small ice crystals diluting the flavor and more or less offsetting that smooth creamy texture that distinguishes gelato from ice cream.From there, neither flavor really blew me away even though these are flavors that I traditionally love. The chocolate was better than the caramel, but even that didn't impress in that it lacked that sort of deep and rich flavor that you might find elsewhere. Maybe an off night, but I really wasn't impressed. No Stars Granted.Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?Maybe I caught Fresco on an off night, but with such stiff competition in the immediate area, I simply can't say I'd make Fresco a common spot. No Star Granted.

MUST TRY: Strawberry gelatoThis is perhaps the best gelato that I've had outside of Europe. They pack your cup full of gelato. The value for money is extremely high.Interesting flavours, and none of the "let's blend two slightly weak tasting flavours together because it's cool". I prefer a strong isolated taste.Double chocolate is a solid chocolate. Not too rich, but reasonably strong flavour. Not dark enough to be bitter. Just right, but it's outshined by the strawberry.Ferrero is surprising in its consistency. A light chocolate, with a nut flavour that is spread evenly across each bite.Strawberry was intense. Fruity and sweet, but with a slightly sour aftertaste that didn't overwhelm. A refreshing and unique flavour.Try the strawberry

My friends and I stumbled upon here last Wednesday, hoping to find a place to study and a place to satisfy our sweet tooth. The place was very comfortable and there was free wifi too! The menu had a variety of brunch and lunch options (their lunch bowls looked pretty good). The staff were really patient with my indecisiveness when it came to picking a gelato flavor. The favors tasted exactly like they sounded. The lemon basil is a must try!
Meh. Better than Haagen-dads. But no comparison to the average gelato you'd find in Italy. Nice place though.

I always pass by this spot but I never made the effort to check it out...until today! It's a very cute and cozy place with cushioned seats and just the right-kind-of-quiet environment to do work while enjoying some sweet gelato. I was awed by the mountainous buckets in the display and more surprised that they had a matcha flavor--my favorite! I shared a two scoop cup with my friend, of course we got matcha, and strawberry sorbet. The scoops are huge for their price ($5.50) and the authenticity of the flavors is even more incredible. It is honestly so hard to find good ice cream and gelato spots--in this part of the village my favorites are Sundaes and Cones & Amorino, but now Fresco deserves to be on that list as well.

Okay so when I saw 'rose water' I have to admit it totally threw me off, the only rose water I love is the spray for my face lol but I gave it a shot, along with a scoop of ferrero & salted caramel. It was a rather unique but tasty combination of flavors! I took a few scoops to enjoy & passed the rest off as i couldn't eat anymore, but honestly that's how I usually am with sweet treats.

I tried their matcha gelato and it was to die for! Not overly sweet and it was a huge portion for the price. $4 for a scoop that turned out to be 2 regular scoops I would have done at home. Nice, but somewhat bored server. Family owned so I think her son wanted to be somewhere else. Other than that, it was a very cute shop, open and bright. Could hold about 10 ppl comfortably and more if you squeezed. Would definitely come back for more matcha!

The gelato was alright. Maybe it would be good to other people who haven't had actual gelato from Italy, but to me at least, wasn't too impressive. Had the strawberry gelato and was pretty sugary and the texture wasn't really "smooth"--not sure how to exactly describe that lol. But if you're a tourist, you'll probably like it. It a single cup for .50

Cute and full of gelato, breakfast and baked goods -- what else can you ask for??There are many 'different' flavors like lemon basil and salted crumble. I tried some of the other flavors and they were all just okay -- but when I tried the salted crumble it was BEYOND AMAZING. I emitted a verbal "OMG" when I tasted it and immediately ordered the salted crumble in a small cup.5/5 for this one flavor alone. Stop by for some gelato in a nice, well-decorated, clean cafe and just get the SALTED CRUMBLE. Truly amazing!

Came here after a meal because we still hadnt had our fill. Split a Pollo y Mole (pulled chicken and guacamole, must try with bfalo hot sauce) and it didn't disappoint.You know a sandwich is good if you enjoy on a stomach that's already been fed.

Finally tried this Mexican sandwich place. Everything about this place is "almost" five stars, due to overloading of one ingredient or not enough of another.Shockingly, the homemade fried corn chips were better than the carnitas sandwich. They're the best chips I've had outside of the west coast. The chips are five stars, the sandwich four, which was super salty and meaty. Wouldn't get this again. Their Chilaquiles is also so tasty, but too bean-heavy. The corn also had too much lime in it.

I'm not sure how I worked myself into a mood for tortas, but I did somehow and was sure glad to find that this place exists.Locating Miscelanea is most of the work: it's a very small store front on the northern side of 4th street. It doesn't exactly look like a torta/sandwich bar or anything because it actually doubles as a small, overpriced, mexican 'grocery'- but if you actually step further inside you'll realize that there's a counter at the back with a small kitchen as well.They primarily do tortas here, but I think they do salads or something like that as well. I myself opted for the carnitas torta because it didn't have any cheese. It was pretty good, but like many sandwiches it suffered from the small problem of poor structural integrity. The bread part of the sandwich was getting kind of soggy and beginning to fall apart by the time I had gotten to the end of the sandwich. Part of the problem is that the sauce from the sandwich ingredients had begun to seep into the bread, but part of the problem as well could be that they just used too soft a bread in the first place. Perhaps if I had eaten it here, it would have fared better.Will be back!

Got hungry and decided to pass by and grab something quick.Small little Shop with bar stool sitting for 4 ppl and a little bench right outside the door.Iced coffee with horchata- interesting taste. I normally drink hot black coffee with no sugar no milk. I decided to give this a try since it was kinda warm outside and this is apparently their signature drink. It took a couple sips for me to get used to it. It's naturally sweet from the horchata. Coffee taste is not that strong. It does have an interesting fragrant taste to it. Not sure how to describe it. For a black coffee drinker, it was different but I enjoyed it.Carnitas torta- delicious. The pork meat was so moist, savory, and flavorful. There was so much juicy flavor in every bite. I loved it and recommend everyone to try it. It comes with a side of tortilla chips and a little cup of spicy radish type of thing with carrots that I poured onto my sandwich. It gave it a nice spicy kick. If I was around the area, I'd dwfinitely give this place a try again
Had a great carnitas sandwich with guacamole, onions and Oaxaca cheese. Perfect place to take away your hunger with an extremely casual ambience. Will certainly be back sometime. Gracias!

This is the best torta I've had. Period. I ordered the carnitas which comes with a smear of black beans (I hate when beans overpower a sandwich/burrito/whatever) but they don't do that here. Next up, guacamole, pickled red onions, cilantro AND *heart stops* this succulent, generous portion of carnitas! Just so good. I doused my torta with some Valentina hot sauce and scooped up the rest of my carnitas drippings with the tortilla chips. I came on a weekday before the cray lunch hour so it was just me. A couple more people came in as I was leaving. It's a small shop with few seats so you can grab a stool or grab a to-go. Happy eating!

this little shop is packed with flavor, i got their carnitas torta and their esquites, talk about amazing! they carnitas was so juicy with every bite i took, i would definitely recommend trying that one. They also have their own bottled horchata flavors-- i tried the mango horchata and it was really refreshing. If you're in New York and you're trying to find places to try this is the one!!!Very sweet workers as well.
DELICIOUS carnitas tortas!!! And the fresh made horchata and guava drink was great. They even hooked it up with an apple cinnamon muffin for chatting with them. I definitely recommend these tortas.

Really cute storefront and vibes but my sandwich was ehhh.Looking at everyone's photos it seems I should have gone for the carnitas but I got the Jamon and Queso. The ham was pretty salty and I wish they toasted the bread and gave the sandwich a little more love instead of just throwing stuff unto it.I came during a lunch break and it took about 15 minutes, so be prepared to wait! The workers are nice though and they have interesting artisan goods there mixed with traditional Mexican items (overpriced of course).

Coffee horchata is going to be the next big thing, even if I have to make it the next big thing all on my own. Miscelanea puts it first on its drink menu, as they understand its rightful place. And they get it to you fast.The texture is a little bit unusual at first, as there's a little bit of grit from the rice milk and cinnamon, but this fades away by the end. It's very solid coffee, with a nice tang of bitterness to offset the creaminess of the horchata. The sweetness is perfectly calibrated-- if all iced coffee was served this way New Yorkers might be a little less grumpy.All this for $3.50? Sold. Throw in the Mexican pantry items and you have your ideal neighborhood stop. I've been coming here since I moved to the village to stock up on Topo Chico (the fizziest seltzer on the market), but now it's clear I'll have to make this a weekly coffee destination as well.

I'm not much a big fan of this place, especially for their mediocre coffee and the fact that they don't serve skim milk. The whole place was tiny and a bit lack of organization. If you are looking for something warm with dairy, you pretty much left with one option - coffee negro, and will have to pour the milk by yourself.Probably I was not trying the right thing; probably I should just give a try on their savory stuff; probably I should just go with their in-house made juice. But as of now, I was a bit disappointed.

A bit off the beaten path lies a charming bodega and cafe -- Miscalenea NY. The carnita torta was hefty and substantial; perfect for sharing among two people on a self-directed walking tour of good eats in the area. You don't feel so bad for shelling out nearly $10... the same price of avocado toast in the city!The torta was packed with moist strands of seasoned pork and a few crispier pieces for good measure. The torta is dressed with a green salsa/avocado mix and a few pieces of pickled onions and fresh cilantro. Off to the side, there's a small container of pickled veggies which were absolutely delicious and helped cut the richness from the sandwich, and a handful of homemade tortilla chips. The counter personnel came by and provided some additional green hot sauce to use on the chips.It's a very small storefront with only a few bar stools, so your best bet is to grab'n'go.

So delicious! A bit messy to eat but totally worth the pile of napkins... I ordered the chorizo and egg sandwich, added queso oaxaca. Super tasty. Awesome little spot, they take credit cards (swish), and everyone working there is a gem. Go here!

Wow, the tortas de carnitas are truly phenomenal. The meat is tender and juicy... incredibly flavorful.The place closes at 7p, so get there early... you won't regret it.10% off your first purchase if you check in on Yelp. Service also great.The deli has a handful of seats, but it's very tiny... barely enough place to make your order and eat it outside on a couple of small wooden benches.Recommended.

4.5!!!this small, easy to miss space serves killer lunch + caffeine pick-me-ups. I've tried the coffee horchata and it was amazing. the aqua frescas are pretty good as well, although they change every day so you never know what you'll get until you get there AHAHA. I haven't tried any of their actual food items yet, so I'm looking forward to trying it out! the staff is lovely also.

Awesome! It's a small place, but it wasn't busy when we went at 3:00 PM so we had seating at the bar. Tried the vegetarian temi and the carnitas and both were on point. Great staff, the hibiscus was delicious and would recommend the cafe de ollo .. not super authentic but a good coffee. Pricing was awesome and music was fun. I'm still full! Loved it will definitely be back.

AUTHENTIC Mexican grub and SO MUCH MORE!CARNITAS TORTAA delicious concoction of juicy tender pork partnered with some avocado, salsa and refried beans, man this was comfort food. The bun perfectly toasted, just pure yummy.The drinks sound awesome too! Cafe horchata galore AND they make homemade Agua Frescas (fruit waters) like Passion fruit Tamarind!10% DISCOUNT YELP CHECK-INBesides the food, this is a mini Mexican supermarket! Mole sauces, rare Mexican candies, an array of hot sauces, Jarritos drinks and even.. chapulines. aka grasshoppers, EEK!LOVE the "Make America Mexico Again" hats :)Ironically ate here the day our new demagogue, I mean.. President-elect, won the election (see pics)Recommended: Carnitas Torta w/ Oaxaca Cheese
Randomly Yelp'd lunch in the search bar and found this little gem. The huevo con chorizo was to die for!

This place is so cute! Kind of dangerous because it's near my office and I think I might become a regular here. I'm from Texas and it's so hard to find some good, affordable Mexican food in the city. I inhaled the carnitas torts and was sad when it was gone. Also, anytime I see Valentina sauce I pretty much get excited because I grew up on that. The staff is super friendly and helpful. Hope my next visit here is just as successful!
Very good Torta. The flavor balance is perfect - not overwhelming, but definitely a lot in each bite. I will be back for sure.

New, clean, very well maintained yet tiny Mexican establishment. Solid queso oaxaca torta but slightly on the bland side. But seems like the place is quite authentic Mexican place (I do not see burrito being served here). Generous portion torta and reasonable pricing ($8).Final verdict: A solid but not spectacular sandwich place, not quite sold yet at this site. A bit of trek to visit this location from my place in Queens so not sure when I will return again. But when I do, I will get the non-vegetarian (e.g. chorizo/jamon) torta next time.

Miscelanea is a cozy sandwich shop tucked away on a quiet street. Their specialty is the torta sandwiches, and they have a good selection to pick from. There is very limited seating (all counter space), so people who eat in usually sit outside.The tortas are good. We got the carnitas and the pollo y mole. The pollo was our favorite with melt-in-your-mouth tenderness and great flavor. Both sandwiches were big in portion and satisfying.It is a good deal for $9. And newcomers, be sure to check in and get 10% off. I will come back and try another torta when I'm in that part of town!

This place is amazing. I've never been a fan of Mexican tortas but this place has converted me. The carnitas is truly great. We live in midtown and taxi down just for lunch here! That really should say a lot as we spend over the cost of the meal for the transportation just to get our tortas fix!

I originally wanted to stop by the Bowery Market for a sandwich, but unfortunately the one sandwich place in the market was being renovated. Good thing my Yelper had my back and directed me to his awesome Mexican deli/market!I ordered the jamon & queso oaxaca torta and the papaya mango aguas frescas (per the suggestion of the gentleman behind the counter) to go. I thought the size of the torta was really generous for the price ($8), but the price for the aguas frescas ($4.50) was slightly steep. The torta was super delicious! I loved all the components and how they went together, and I would highly recommend that for any non-vegetarian guests. It also came with a small bag of (homemade?) tortilla chips, which was a nice gesture. Overall, I thought my meal was a great value, since it was actually large enough to eat over TWO meals!As others have mentioned, I had a fun time looking around at all the grocery items while waiting for my food. There were quite a few hilarious trinkets (Trump's hat but with "Make America Mexico again") and interesting food items that you'd be hard pressed to find anywhere else in Manhattan. Finally, the employees were super friendly and so sweet - given the sweltering weather outside, they insisted that I stay for lunch even though I wanted to take it to go. I still went home, but really appreciated the gesture. :PI've already raved about the tortas to all of my friends and I can't wait to stop by for lunch and the horchata with coffee next time!! Definitely a hidden gem in East Village!
