Awesome little place. My friend and I had the carnitas tortas and queso tortas and they were amazing. I hadn't had them before and I'll definitely be adding them into the rotation. The guy behind the counter also gave us free baked goods (assuming since it was near closing, but who's complaining). The cinnamon mini muffin I had was pretty good.Limited seating so don't bring 5 friends!

Bookmarked this place some time back and finally had the chance to stop in Saturday for lunch. Walking in, your first impression is that it's a small place. A small seating area outside, no tables. Selective grocery/general merchandise within the store on the right and a mini table against the wall to the left. Take a few more steps and you're at the counter.I ordered the Carnita torta and Cafe helado. The sandwich is huge! Super juicy and tasty. They serve it with super crispy nacho chips. As for the coffee, you get your choice of milk without the additional $1/.75 for almond milk - bonus star for that. Overall I'd come back to try the other items on their menu.

The horchata iced coffee!!! YUM~~As an avid coffee drinker and an horchata lover, this combo was a no-brainer. And I'm so glad I decided to try it, because it was delicious and quite possibly the highlight of my day. It is also vegan because they use non-dairy milk for the horchata!The carnitas torta was also so great! However, it is quite heavy. The portion is also huge as well! Definitely worth the price, but might want to consider splitting with a friend if you have a smaller stomach.Overall, this is one of those small hole-in-the-wall type shops.. But more like a hidden jewel. It is super cute with a wonderful concept, friendly staff, and great food. I will definitely return again! ESPECIALLY for the horchata ice coffee. Also the Trump-bashing artwork in the front of the shop is a plus.
this Mexican cafe has amazing tortas, however the majority of the time i ask for the #huevoconchorizo in a bowl- the chef knows exactly how I like it, and tops it with a little guacamole!
Carnitas torta hit the spot! Definitely recommend checking this place out. I will be stopping back here again the next time I visit NYC!

Went here to grab a bite to eat on a chilly Saturday afternoon. The place wasn't too packed so I was able to order right away--btw, this place is not only a restaurant, it also houses some interesting cookbooks, jellies, and other assorted items that are worth perusing through.At the suggestion of the cashier, I decided to go with the carnitas sammy. The sandwich came to about $9 (with the 10% off Yelp check in) and was a decent size. The meat was very tender and flavorful and paired nicely with the bun. My only complaint was that I wish they had included more pickled onions on my sandwich, but otherwise it was fantastic. Definitely a place worth checking out if you're in the area--but be aware that it's mostly take out since the seating is limited.

The carnitas torta was delightful - i added cheese & it tasted phenomenal. There was just enough salsa, onion & cilantro to balance the slightly overwhelming taste of the pulled pork. The bun was yummy. There's really nothing bad I can say e this place.Service at the Miscelanea NY was great too!! Really friendly staff, minimal wait time for food, & just enough space to enjoy your food.

TL:DRCheap and delicious. Absolutely great torta temi con carnitas. I love this place on the way to the gym, on my way from the gym, on my way to class, on my way from class, on my way anywhere actually. I would definitely recommend coming out here yourself and understanding why I come so often. Try their coffee if you could it's great.

Absolutely enjoyed my experience here! I tried the 'Carnitas' (recommended by Marcos) and I loved it. I never tried a sandwich with beans before, but it fit so well with the cheese and the meat. I also tried my friend's vegetarian sandwich and that was amazing as well, although the meat one was better for my taste. I would definitely come here again not just for the food, but also for the amazing service! Marcos and Victor were both wonderful. My friend and I didn't know that the place closed at 7pm until we saw them cleaning up and realized they let us stay 30-40 min past their closing time. I thought it was so nice of them to not intrude our conversation and kick us out. Highly recommend!

I tried the Pollo Mole and Carnitas sandwiches.Pollo Mole (chicken) was my favorite of the two. Both were amazing. They each offer unique taste so worth trying both (I suggest going with a friend, ordering both and then splitting).PROS:Generous amount of foodPrompt service4 star taste (really good)EXTREMELY friendly staffCONS:Limited seating (4-5 people can sit inside)Food is 4* good not 5*, as the reviews would make you think. Still worth visiting don't get me wrong.Would I recommend to a friend? Yes. Definitely try it if you're looking for great Mexican food.
pretty good place, really good nowhere really to sit. But I really liked the tortas, small menu, and service. Would recommend in a rush

Really wanted to like this place on account of all the positive reviews, but I didn't think it was anything special. We got the jamon y queso and the carnitas. Carnitas was the much better option. Bread might not have been substantial enough to hold all the juices so my sandwich ended up a sopping mess. At $9 a sandwich, I don't think it's worth coming back.Lady that took our order was very friendly and helpful though.

Delicious Huevos con chorizo tortas and Chilaquiles! Prices are around $9, which is not bad at all for manhattan. The food here taste authentic and very similar to the ones you'll find in Queens, specifically Jackson heights/elmhurst area where there is a lot of excellent Mexican food!
I had the carnitas sandwich and it was as good as the reviews claim! So so good!Inexpensive and adorable spot for grabbing something quick.
